18057:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
18058:                    end},
18059: 
18060:          #{desc => "open src socket",
18061:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
18062:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
18063:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
18064:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
18065:                    end},
18066:          #{desc => "bind src",
18067:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
18068:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
18069:                                ok ->
18070:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
18071:                                    ok;
18072:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18073:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
18074:                                    ERROR
18075:                            end
18076:                    end},
18077:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
18078:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
18079:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
18080:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
18081:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
18082:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
18083:                    end},
18084:          #{desc => "get current (default) timestamp for src socket",
18085:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
18086:                            case Get(Sock) of
18087:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
18088:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src timestamp: ~p", [Value]),
18089:                                    ok;
18090:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
18091:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src timestamp: ~p",
18092:                                                [Unexpected]),
18093:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
18094:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18095:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
18096:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18097:                                    ERROR
18098:                            end
18099:                    end},
18100: 
18101:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
18102:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
18103:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
18104:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
18105:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
18106:                    end},
18107:          #{desc => "bind dst",
18108:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
18109:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
18110:                                ok ->
18111:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
18112:                                    ok;
18113:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18114:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
18115:                                    ERROR
18116:                            end
18117:                    end},
18118:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
18119:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
18120:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
18121:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
18122:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
18123:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
18124:                    end},
18125: 
18126:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (WO TIMESTAMP)",
18127:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
18128:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
18129:                    end},
18130:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
18131:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
18132:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18133:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18134:                                    ok;
18135:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
18136:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
18137:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
18138:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
18139:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
18140:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
18141:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
18142:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
18143:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
18144:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
18145:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
18146:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18147:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18148:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
18149:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
18150:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
18151:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
18152:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
18153:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
18154:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18155:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18156:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18157:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18158:                                    ERROR
18159:                            end
18160:                    end},
18161:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
18162:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
18163:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
18164:                    end},
18165:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
18166:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
18167:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18168:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18169:                                    ok;
18170:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18171:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18172:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18173:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18174:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18175:                                    ERROR
18176:                            end
18177:                    end},
18178: 
18179: 
18180:          #{desc => "enable timestamp on dst socket",
18181:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
18182:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
18183:                                ok ->
18184:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst timestamp enabled"),
18185:                                    ok;
18186:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18187:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting timestamp:"
18188:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18189:                                    ERROR
18190:                            end
18191:                    end},
18192: 
18193: 
18194:          #{desc => "send req 1 (to dst) (W TIMESTAMP)",
18195:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
18196:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
18197:                    end},
18198:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
18199:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
18200:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18201:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := socket,
18202:                                              type  := timestamp,
18203:                                              value := TS}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18204:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *with* "
18205:                                                "expected timestamp: "
18206:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
18207:                                    ok;
18208:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18209:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected control message(s):"
18210:                                                "~n   CMsgs: ~p",
18211:                                                [CMsgs]),
18212:                                    {error, {unexpected_cmsgs, CMsgs}};
18213:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18214:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18215:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18216:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18217:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18218:                                    ERROR
18219:                            end
18220:                    end},
18221:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
18222:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
18223:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
18224:                    end},
18225:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
18226:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
18227:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18228:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18229:                                    ok;
18230:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18231:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18232:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18233:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18234:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18235:                                    ERROR
18236:                            end
18237:                    end},
18238: 
18239: 
18240:          #{desc => "send req 2 (to dst) (W TIMESTAMP)",
18241:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
18242:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
18243:                    end},
18244:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
18245:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
18246:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18247:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := socket,
18248:                                              type  := timestamp,
18249:                                              value := TS}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18250:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *with* "
18251:                                                "expected timestamp: "
18252:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
18253:                                    ok;
18254:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18255:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18256:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18257:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18258:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18259:                                    ERROR
18260:                            end
18261:                    end},
18262:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
18263:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
18264:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
18265:                    end},
18266:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
18267:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
18268:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18269:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18270:                                    ok;
18271:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18272:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18273:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18274:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18275:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18276:                                    ERROR
18277:                            end
18278:                    end},
18279: 
18280: 
18281:          #{desc => "disable timestamps on dst socket",
18282:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
18283:                            case Set(Sock, false) of
18284:                                ok ->
18285:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst timestamp disabled"),
18286:                                    ok;
18287:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18288:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting timestamp:"
18289:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18290:                                    ERROR
18291:                            end
18292:                    end},
18293: 
18294: 
18295:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (WO TIMESTAMP)",
18296:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
18297:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
18298:                    end},
18299:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
18300:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
18301:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18302:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18303:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *without* timestamp"),
18304:                                    ok;
18305:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18306:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18307:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18308:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18309:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18310:                                    ERROR
18311:                            end
18312:                    end},
18313:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
18314:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
18315:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
18316:                    end},
18317:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
18318:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
18319:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18320:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18321:                                    ok;
18322:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
18323:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
18324:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18325:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
18326:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
18327:                                    ERROR
18328:                            end
18329:                    end},
18330: 
18331: 
18332:          #{desc => "close src socket",
18333:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
18334:                          sock_src := Sock,
18335:                          lsa_src  := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
18336:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18337:                            State1 =
18338:                                unlink_path(Path,
18339:                                            fun() -> maps:remove(lsa_src, State) end,
18340:                                            fun() -> State end),
18341:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State1)};
18342:                       (#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
18343:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18344:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
18345:                    end},
18346:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
18347:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
18348:                          sock_dst := Sock,
18349:                          lsa_dst  := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
18350:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18351:                            State1 =
18352:                                unlink_path(Path,
18353:                                            fun() -> maps:remove(lsa_dst, State) end,
18354:                                            fun() -> State end),
18355:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State1)};
18356:                       (#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
18357:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18358:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
18359:                    end},
18360: 
18361:          %% *** We are done ***
18362:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
18363:         ],
18364:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
18365:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
18366: 
18367: 
18368: 
18369: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
18370: 
18371: %% Tests that the timestamp control message header is received when
18372: %% setting the socket 'socket' option true when using sendmsg/recvmsg
18373: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
18374: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
18375: %%
18376: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, boolean()).
18377: %%
18378: %% All subsequent *received* messages will be timestamped.
18379: %%
18380: %% There is no mention of this not working for TCP in the man page
18381: %% on a SLES 11 SP4 machine (=> 3.0.101-108.87), but it does not
18382: %% (we don't get a timestamp control message header when its enabled).
18383: %% It also does not work on SLES 12 SP2 (=> 4.4.120-92.70), 
18384: %% so we start by skipping from that version (4.4.120) or older!
18385: %% Don't actually know if its the distro or the (kernel) version...
18386: %%
18387: 
18388: api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
18389:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
18390:     tc_try(api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp4,
18391:            fun() ->
18392:                    has_support_ipv4(),
18393:                    has_support_sock_timestamp(),
18394:                    is_good_enough_linux({4,4,120}),
18395:                    is_not_freebsd(),
18396:                    is_not_openbsd(),
18397:                    is_not_netbsd(),
18398:                    is_not_darwin()
18399:            end,
18400:            fun() ->
18401:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
18402:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, Value)
18403:                           end,
18404:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
18405:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, socket, timestamp)
18406:                           end,
18407:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data) ->
18408:                                   Msg = #{iov  => [Data]},
18409:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
18410:                           end,
18411:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
18412:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
18413:                                       {ok, #{ctrl := CMsgs,
18414:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
18415:                                           {ok, {CMsgs, Data}};
18416:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
18417:                                           ERROR
18418:                                   end
18419:                           end,
18420:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
18421:                                  proto  => tcp,
18422:                                  send   => Send,
18423:                                  recv   => Recv,
18424:                                  set    => Set,
18425:                                  get    => Get},
18426:                    ok = api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp(InitState)
18427:            end).
18428: 
18429: 
18430: 
18431: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
18432: 
18433: api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp(InitState) ->
18434:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
18435:     ServerSeq =
18436:         [
18437:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
18438:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
18439:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
18440:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
18441:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
18442:                    end},
18443:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
18444:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18445:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
18446:                            ok
18447:                    end},
18448: 
18449:          %% *** Init part ***
18450:          #{desc => "which local address",
18451:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
18452:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
18453:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
18454:                    end},
18455:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
18456:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
18457:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
18458:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
18459:                                {ok, Sock} ->
18460:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
18461:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18462:                                    ERROR
18463:                            end
18464:                    end},
18465:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
18466:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
18467:                          lsock  := LSock,
18468:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
18469:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
18470:                                ok ->
18471:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
18472:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18473:                                    ERROR
18474:                            end;
18475:                       (#{lsock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = State) ->
18476:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
18477:                                ok ->
18478:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
18479:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
18480:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
18481:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18482:                                    ERROR
18483:                            end
18484:                    end},
18485:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
18486:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
18487:                            socket:listen(LSock)
18488:                    end},
18489:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
18490:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
18491:                          tester := Tester, lsa := #{path := Path}}) ->
18492:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
18493:                            ok;
18494:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
18495:                            %% This is actually not used for unix domain socket
18496:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
18497:                            ok
18498:                    end},
18499: 
18500: 
18501:          %% The actual test
18502:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
18503:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18504:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
18505:                    end},
18506:          #{desc => "await connection",
18507:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
18508:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
18509:                                {ok, Sock} ->
18510:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: ~n   ~p", [Sock]),
18511:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
18512:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18513:                                    ERROR
18514:                            end
18515:                    end},
18516:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
18517:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18518:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
18519:                            ok
18520:                    end},
18521: 
18522:          %% *** First message ***
18523: 
18524:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 1",
18525:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
18526:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18527:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18528:                                    ok;
18529:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18530:                                    ERROR
18531:                            end
18532:                    end},
18533:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
18534:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18535:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
18536:                            ok
18537:                    end},
18538:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
18539:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18540:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
18541:                    end},
18542:          #{desc => "send reply",
18543:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18544:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
18545:                    end},
18546:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
18547:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18548:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
18549:                            ok
18550:                    end},
18551: 
18552:          %% *** Second message ***
18553: 
18554:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 2",
18555:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
18556:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18557:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18558:                                    ok;
18559:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18560:                                    ERROR
18561:                            end
18562:                    end},
18563:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
18564:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18565:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
18566:                            ok
18567:                    end},
18568:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
18569:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18570:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
18571:                    end},
18572:          #{desc => "send reply",
18573:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18574:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
18575:                    end},
18576:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
18577:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18578:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
18579:                            ok
18580:                    end},
18581: 
18582:          %% *** Third message ***
18583: 
18584:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 3",
18585:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
18586:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18587:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
18588:                                    ok;
18589:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18590:                                    ERROR
18591:                            end
18592:                    end},
18593:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
18594:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18595:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
18596:                            ok
18597:                    end},
18598:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
18599:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18600:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
18601:                    end},
18602:          #{desc => "send reply",
18603:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18604:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
18605:                    end},
18606:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
18607:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18608:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
18609:                            ok
18610:                    end},
18611: 
18612:          %% *** Termination ***
18613:          #{desc => "await terminate",
18614:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
18615:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
18616:                                ok ->
18617:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
18618:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18619:                                    ERROR
18620:                            end
18621:                    end},
18622:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
18623:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
18624:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18625:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
18626:                    end},
18627:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
18628:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
18629:                          lsock    := Sock,
18630:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
18631:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18632:                            State1 =
18633:                                unlink_path(Path,
18634:                                            fun() ->
18635:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
18636:                                            end,
18637:                                            fun() -> State end),
18638:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
18639:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
18640:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
18641:                                ok ->
18642:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
18643:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18644:                                    ERROR
18645:                            end
18646:                    end},
18647: 
18648:          %% *** We are done ***
18649:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
18650:         ],
18651: 
18652: 
18653:     ClientSeq =
18654:         [
18655:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
18656:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
18657:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local} = State) ->
18658:                            {Tester, Path} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
18659:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_path => Path}};
18660:                       (State) ->
18661:                            {Tester, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
18662:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_port => Port}}
18663:                    end},
18664:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
18665:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18666:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
18667:                            ok
18668:                    end},
18669: 
18670:          %% *** The init part ***
18671:          #{desc => "which server (local) address",
18672:            cmd  => fun(#{domain      := local = Domain,
18673:                          server_path := Path} = State) ->
18674:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
18675:                            SSA = #{family => Domain, path => Path},
18676:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}};
18677:                       (#{domain := Domain, server_port := Port} = State) ->
18678:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
18679:                            SSA = LSA#{port => Port},
18680:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}}
18681:                    end},
18682:          #{desc => "create socket",
18683:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
18684:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
18685:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
18686:                                {ok, Sock} ->
18687:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
18688:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18689:                                    ERROR
18690:                            end
18691:                    end},
18692:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
18693:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
18694:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
18695:                                ok ->
18696:                                    ok;
18697:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18698:                                    ERROR
18699:                            end
18700:                    end},
18701:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
18702:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18703:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
18704:                            ok
18705:                    end},
18706: 
18707:          %% *** The actual test ***
18708:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
18709:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18710:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect)
18711:                    end},
18712:          #{desc => "connect to server",
18713:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := SSA}) ->
18714:                            socket:connect(Sock, SSA)
18715:                    end},
18716:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
18717:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18718:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
18719:                            ok
18720:                    end},
18721: 
18722:          %% *** First message (default=wo timestamp) ***
18723: 
18724:          #{desc => "await continue (verify timestamp off)",
18725:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18726:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, verify_timestamp)
18727:                    end},
18728:          #{desc => "verify timestamp off",
18729:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
18730:                            case Get(Sock) of
18731:                                {ok, false = _Value} ->
18732:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp: ~p", [_Value]),
18733:                                    ok;
18734:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
18735:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected timestamp: ~p",
18736:                                                [Unexpected]),
18737:                                    {error, {unexpected_timestamp, Unexpected}};
18738:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
18739:                                    {skip, Reason};
18740:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18741:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting timestamp:"
18742:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18743:                                    ERROR
18744:                            end                                   
18745:                    end},
18746:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp off)",
18747:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18748:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_off),
18749:                            ok
18750:                    end},
18751: 
18752:          #{desc => "await continue (send request)",
18753:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18754:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
18755:                    end},
18756:          #{desc => "send request 1 (to server)",
18757:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18758:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
18759:                    end},
18760:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request)",
18761:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18762:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
18763:                            ok
18764:                    end},
18765:          #{desc => "await recv reply 1 (from server, wo timestamp)",
18766:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
18767:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18768:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18769:                                    ok;
18770:                                {ok, {[], UnexpData}} ->
18771:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_data, UnexpData}};
18772:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18773:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
18774:                                             BadCMsgs}};
18775:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
18776:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
18777:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18778:                                    ERROR
18779:                            end
18780:                    end},
18781:          #{desc => "announce ready 1 (recv reply)",
18782:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18783:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
18784:                            ok
18785:                    end},
18786: 
18787:          %% *** Second message (w timestamp) ***
18788: 
18789:          #{desc => "await continue (enable timestamp)",
18790:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18791:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, enable_timestamp)
18792:                    end},
18793:          #{desc => "enable timestamp",
18794:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
18795:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
18796:                                ok ->
18797:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp enabled"),
18798:                                    ok;
18799:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18800:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed enable timestamp:"
18801:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18802:                                    ERROR
18803:                            end                                   
18804:                    end},
18805:          %% Linux peculiarity observed here...
18806:          %% Detected on Kernel 4.15.0-72 x96_64.
18807:          %% The option set to enable receiving timestamps just above
18808:          %% has failed to be effective down in "await recv reply 2
18809:          %% (from server, w timestamp)" below, unless we put the
18810:          %% sleep between setting the option and informing
18811:          %% the writer that it shall write to the other socket end.
18812:          %% A sleep 1 ms improves a lot but does not remove
18813:          %% problem completely. Believe it or not.
18814:          ?SEV_SLEEP(100),
18815:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp on)",
18816:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18817:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_on),
18818:                            ok
18819:                    end},
18820: 
18821:          #{desc => "await continue (send request 2)",
18822:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18823:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
18824:                    end},
18825:          #{desc => "send request 2 (to server)",
18826:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18827:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
18828:                    end},
18829:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request 2)",
18830:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18831:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
18832:                            ok
18833:                    end},
18834:          #{desc => "await recv reply 2 (from server, w timestamp)",
18835:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, get := Get}) ->
18836:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18837:                                {ok, {[#{level := socket,
18838:                                         type  := timestamp,
18839:                                         value := TS}], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18840:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received reply *with* "
18841:                                                "expected timestamp: "
18842:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
18843:                                    ok;
18844:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18845:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("received reply *with* "
18846:                                                "unexpected cmsg headers:"
18847:                                                "~n   ~p"
18848:                                                "Current timestamp value: "
18849:                                                "~n   ~p",
18850:                                                [BadCMsgs, Get(Sock)]),
18851:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
18852:                                             BadCMsgs}};
18853:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
18854:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
18855:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18856:                                    ERROR
18857:                            end
18858:                    end},
18859:          #{desc => "announce ready 2 (recv reply)",
18860:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18861:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
18862:                            ok
18863:                    end},
18864: 
18865:          %% *** Third message (wo timestamp) ***
18866: 
18867:          #{desc => "await continue (disable timestamp)",
18868:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18869:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, disable_timestamp)
18870:                    end},
18871:          #{desc => "disable timestamp",
18872:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
18873:                            case Set(Sock, false) of
18874:                                ok ->
18875:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp disabled"),
18876:                                    ok;
18877:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
18878:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed disable timestamp:"
18879:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
18880:                                    ERROR
18881:                            end                                   
18882:                    end},
18883:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp off)",
18884:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18885:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_off),
18886:                            ok
18887:                    end},
18888: 
18889:          #{desc => "await continue (send request 3)",
18890:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
18891:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
18892:                    end},
18893:          #{desc => "send request 3 (to server)",
18894:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
18895:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
18896:                    end},
18897:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request 3)",
18898:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18899:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
18900:                            ok
18901:                    end},
18902:          #{desc => "await recv reply 3 (from server, wo timestamp)",
18903:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
18904:                            case Recv(Sock) of
18905:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18906:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received reply *without* "
18907:                                                "timestamp"),
18908:                                    ok;
18909:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
18910:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
18911:                                             BadCMsgs}};
18912:                                {ok, {[], BadData}} ->
18913:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_data,
18914:                                             BadData}};
18915:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
18916:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
18917:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18918:                                    ERROR
18919:                            end
18920:                    end},
18921:          #{desc => "announce ready 3 (recv reply)",
18922:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
18923:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
18924:                            ok
18925:                    end},
18926: 
18927:          %% *** Termination ***
18928:          #{desc => "await terminate",
18929:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
18930:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
18931:                                ok ->
18932:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
18933:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
18934:                                    ERROR
18935:                            end
18936:                    end},
18937:          #{desc => "close socket",
18938:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
18939:                          sock     := Sock,
18940:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
18941:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18942:                            State1 =
18943:                                unlink_path(Path,
18944:                                            fun() ->
18945:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
18946:                                            end,
18947:                                            fun() -> State end),
18948:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
18949:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
18950:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
18951:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
18952:                    end},
18953: 
18954:          %% *** We are done ***
18955:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
18956:         ],
18957: 
18958: 
18959:     TesterSeq =
18960:         [
18961:          %% *** Init part ***
18962:          #{desc => "monitor server",
18963:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
18964:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
18965:                            ok
18966:                    end},
18967:          #{desc => "monitor client",
18968:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
18969:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
18970:                            ok
18971:                    end},
18972: 
18973:          %% Start the server
18974:          #{desc => "order server start",
18975:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
18976:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
18977:                            ok
18978:                    end},
18979:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
18980:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
18981:                            {ok, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
18982:                            {ok, State#{server_port => Port}}
18983:                    end},
18984: 
18985:          %% Start the client
18986:          #{desc => "order client start",
18987:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_port := Port} = _State) ->
18988:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Port),
18989:                            ok
18990:                    end},
18991:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
18992:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
18993:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
18994:                    end},
18995: 
18996:          %% *** The actual test ***
18997:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with accept)",
18998:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
18999:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, accept),
19000:                            ok
19001:                    end},
19002: %%%         ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
19003:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with connect)",
19004:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19005:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
19006:                            ok
19007:                    end},
19008:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
19009:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19010:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, connect)
19011:                    end},
19012:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept)",
19013:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19014:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept)
19015:                    end},
19016: 
19017:          %% *** First message (default=wo timestamp) ***
19018: 
19019:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with verify timestamp off)",
19020:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19021:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, verify_timestamp),
19022:                            ok
19023:                    end},
19024:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp off)",
19025:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19026:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_off)
19027:                    end},
19028: 
19029:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 1)",
19030:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19031:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
19032:                            ok
19033:                    end},
19034:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 1)",
19035:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19036:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
19037:                    end},
19038:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 1)",
19039:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19040:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
19041:                    end},
19042:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply)",
19043:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19044:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
19045:                            ok
19046:                    end},
19047:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent)",
19048:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19049:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
19050:                    end},
19051:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv)",
19052:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19053:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
19054:                    end},
19055: 
19056:          %% Second message (w timestamp)
19057: 
19058:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with enable timestamp)",
19059:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19060:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, enable_timestamp),
19061:                            ok
19062:                    end},
19063:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp on)",
19064:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19065:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_on)
19066:                    end},
19067: 
19068:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 2)",
19069:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19070:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
19071:                            ok
19072:                    end},
19073:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 2)",
19074:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19075:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
19076:                    end},
19077:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 2)",
19078:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19079:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
19080:                    end},
19081:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply 2)",
19082:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19083:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
19084:                            ok
19085:                    end},
19086:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent 2)",
19087:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19088:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
19089:                    end},
19090:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv 2)",
19091:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19092:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
19093:                    end},
19094: 
19095:          %% Third message (wo timestamp)
19096: 
19097:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with disable timestamp)",
19098:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19099:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, disable_timestamp),
19100:                            ok
19101:                    end},
19102:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp off)",
19103:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19104:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_off)
19105:                    end},
19106: 
19107:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 3)",
19108:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19109:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
19110:                            ok
19111:                    end},
19112:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 3)",
19113:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19114:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
19115:                    end},
19116:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 3)",
19117:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19118:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
19119:                    end},
19120:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply 3)",
19121:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19122:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
19123:                            ok
19124:                    end},
19125:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent 3)",
19126:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19127:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
19128:                    end},
19129:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv 3)",
19130:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19131:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
19132:                    end},
19133: 
19134: 
19135:          %% *** Termination ***
19136:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
19137:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
19138:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
19139:                            ok
19140:                    end},
19141:          #{desc => "await client termination",
19142:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
19143:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
19144:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
19145:                            {ok, State1}
19146:                    end},
19147:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
19148:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19149:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
19150:                            ok
19151:                    end},
19152:          #{desc => "await server termination",
19153:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
19154:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
19155:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
19156:                            {ok, State1}
19157:                    end},
19158: 
19159:          %% *** We are done ***
19160:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
19161:         ],
19162: 
19163: 
19164:     i("start server evaluator"),
19165:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
19166: 
19167:     i("start client evaluator"),
19168:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
19169: 
19170:     i("start tester evaluator"),
19171:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
19172:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
19173:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
19174: 
19175:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
19176: 
19177: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19178: 
19179: %% Tests that the add_mambership and drop_membership ip options work.
19180: %% We create one server and two clients. The server only send messages,
19181: %% the clients only receives messages.
19182: %% An UDP datagram is forbidden (RFC 1122) from having a source address
19183: %% that is a multicast address (or a broadcast address).
19184: %% So, the server create a socket "for sending" and the clients sockets
19185: %% "for receiving".
19186: %% Sending socket:   Bound to the local address (and any port).
19187: %%                   When sending, the dest will be the multicast address
19188: %%                   and port of the receiving socket.
19189: %% Receiving socket: Bound to the multicast address and port.
19190: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership() ->
19191:     [{doc, "OTP-15908 (ERL-980)"}].
19192: 
19193: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
19194:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
19195:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership,
19196:            fun() ->
19197:                    has_support_ip_add_membership(),
19198:                    has_support_ip_drop_membership(),
19199:                    has_support_ip_multicast()
19200:            end,
19201:            fun() -> api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership_do() end).
19202: 
19203: 
19204: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership_do() ->
19205:     Set = fun(S, Key, Val) ->
19206:                   socket:setopt(S, ip, Key, Val)
19207:           end,
19208:     AddMembership  = fun(S, Val) -> Set(S, add_membership,  Val) end,
19209:     DropMembership = fun(S, Val) -> Set(S, drop_membership, Val) end,
19210: 
19211:     ServerSeq =
19212:         [
19213:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
19214:          #{desc => "await start",
19215:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
19216:                            {Tester, MSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
19217:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, msa => MSA}}
19218:                    end},
19219:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
19220:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
19221:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
19222:                            ok
19223:                    end},
19224: 
19225:          %% *** Init part ***
19226:          #{desc => "which local address",
19227:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
19228:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19229:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
19230:                    end},
19231:          #{desc => "create socket",
19232:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
19233:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, udp) of
19234:                                {ok, Sock} ->
19235:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
19236:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19237:                                    ERROR
19238:                            end
19239:                    end},
19240:          #{desc => "make recv socket reuse addr",
19241:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
19242:                            case socket:setopt(Sock, socket, reuseaddr, true) of
19243:                                ok ->
19244:                                    ok;
19245:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19246:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed set reuseaddr: "
19247:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
19248:                                    ERROR
19249:                            end
19250:                    end},
19251:          #{desc => "bind recv socket to multicast address",
19252:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, msa := MSA} = State) ->
19253:                            case sock_bind(Sock, MSA) of
19254:                                ok ->
19255:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
19256:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to:"
19257:                                                "~n   ~p", [Port]),
19258:                                    {ok, State#{msa => MSA#{port => Port}}};
19259:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19260:                                    ERROR
19261:                            end
19262:                    end},
19263:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
19264:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
19265:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
19266:                            ok
19267:                    end},
19268: 
19269:          %% The actual test
19270:          #{desc => "await continue (add_membership)",
19271:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
19272:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, add_membership)
19273:                    end},
19274:          #{desc => "add membership",
19275:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
19276:                          msa      := #{addr := MAddr},
19277:                          local_sa := #{addr := Addr}} = State) ->
19278:                            MReq = #{multiaddr => MAddr,
19279:                                     interface => Addr},
19280:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try add membership to:"
19281:                                        "~n   ~p", [MReq]),
19282:                            case AddMembership(Sock, MReq) of
19283:                                ok ->
19284:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("membership added"),
19285:                                    {ok, State#{mreq => MReq}};
19286:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19287:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed adding membership to: "
19288:                                                "~n   ~p"
19289:                                                "~n   Reason:  ~p",
19290:                                                [MReq, Reason]),
19291:                                    ERROR
19292:                            end
19293:                    end},
19294:          #{desc => "announce ready (add-membership)",
19295:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
19296:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, add_membership),
19297:                            ok
19298:                    end},
19299: 
19300:          #{desc => "await continue (drop_membership)",
19301:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
19302:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, drop_membership)
19303:                    end},
19304:          #{desc => "drop membership",
19305:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
19306:                          mreq := MReq} = State) ->
19307:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try drop membership from:"
19308:                                        "~n   ~p", [MReq]),
19309:                            case DropMembership(Sock, MReq) of
19310:                                ok ->
19311:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("membership dropped"),
19312:                                    {ok, maps:remove(mreq, State)};
19313:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19314:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed drop membership from: "
19315:                                                "~n   ~p"
19316:                                                "~n   Reason:  ~p",
19317:                                                [MReq, Reason]),
19318:                                    ERROR
19319:                            end
19320:                    end},
19321:          #{desc => "announce ready (drop-membership)",
19322:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
19323:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, drop_membership),
19324:                            ok
19325:                    end},
19326: 
19327: 
19328:          %% Termination
19329:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
19330:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
19331:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
19332:                                ok ->
19333:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
19334:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19335:                                    ERROR
19336:                            end
19337:                    end},
19338:          #{desc => "close socket",
19339:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
19340:                            socket:close(Sock),
19341:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
19342:                    end},
19343: 
19344:          %% *** We are done ***
19345:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
19346:         ],
19347: 
19348: 
19349:     TesterSeq =
19350:         [
19351:          %% *** Init part ***
19352:          #{desc => "monitor server",
19353:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19354:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
19355:                            ok
19356:                    end},
19357: 
19358:          %% Start the server
19359:          #{desc => "order server start",
19360:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid, msa := MSA} = _State) ->
19361:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, MSA),
19362:                            ok
19363:                    end},
19364:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
19365:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
19366:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init) of
19367:                                ok ->
19368:                                    ok;
19369:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19370:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Start of server failed: "
19371:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
19372:                                    ERROR
19373:                            end
19374:                    end},
19375: 
19376: 
19377:          %% *** The actual test ***
19378:          #{desc => "order server to continue (add-membership)",
19379:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19380:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, add_membership),
19381:                            ok
19382:                    end},
19383:          #{desc => "await server ready (add-membership)",
19384:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19385:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, add_membership)
19386:                    end},
19387: 
19388:          #{desc => "order server to continue (drop-membership)",
19389:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19390:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, drop_membership),
19391:                            ok
19392:                    end},
19393:          #{desc => "await server ready (drop-membership)",
19394:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19395:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, drop_membership)
19396:                    end},
19397: 
19398:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
19399: 
19400:          %% *** Termination ***
19401:          #{desc => "order server terminate",
19402:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
19403:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
19404:                            ok
19405:                    end},
19406:          #{desc => "await server termination",
19407:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
19408:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
19409:                            {ok, maps:remove(server, State)}
19410:                    end},
19411: 
19412:          %% *** We are done ***
19413:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
19414:         ],
19415: 
19416: 
19417:     Domain = inet,
19418:     i("get multicast address"),
19419:     MAddr  = which_ip_multicast_address(),
19420:     MSA    = #{family => Domain, addr => MAddr},
19421: 
19422:     i("start server evaluator"),
19423:     ServerInitState = #{domain => Domain},
19424:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
19425: 
19426:     i("start tester evaluator"),
19427:     TesterInitState = #{domain  => Domain,
19428:                         msa     => MSA,
19429:                         server  => Server#ev.pid},
19430:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
19431: 
19432:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
19433:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester, Server]).
19434: 
19435: 
19436: 
19437: which_ip_multicast_address() ->
19438:     which_multicast_address(inet).
19439: 
19440: which_multicast_address(Domain) ->
19441:     case os:type() of
19442:         {unix, linux} ->
19443:             WhichMAddr = fun([_, _, MAddr]) -> MAddr end,
19444:             which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr);
19445: 
19446:         {unix, sunos} ->
19447:             WhichMAddr = fun([_, MAddr, _]) -> MAddr end,
19448:             which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr);
19449: 
19450:         Type ->
19451:             %% Actually, what is "not supported". is netstat!
19452:             not_supported({multicast, Type})
19453:     end.
19454: 
19455: %% Note that the 'netstat -g' table looks different on linux and SunOS
19456: %% Linux: IfName - RefCnt - Group
19457: %% SunOS: IfName - Group  - RefCnt
19458: 
19459: which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr) ->
19460:     IfName = which_local_host_ifname(Domain),
19461:     %% On some platforms the netstat barfs out some crap on stderr
19462:     %% before the actual info...
19463:     %% ...without the 'n' (that is; just '-g') this command can take a
19464:     %% *long* time. *With* the 'n' its much better. But just to be on
19465:     %% the safe side, we add a timeout of 10 seconds.
19466:     case ?SLIB:os_cmd("netstat -gn 2>/dev/null | grep " ++ IfName, ?SECS(10)) of
19467:         {error, timeout} ->
19468:             skip({netstat, timeout});
19469:         {ok, []} ->
19470:             %% Can't figure out if we support multicast or not...
19471:             not_supported(no_netstat);
19472:         {ok, NetstatGroupsStr} ->
19473:             try
19474:                 begin
19475:                     NetstatGroups0   = string:tokens(NetstatGroupsStr, [$\n]),
19476:                     NetstatGroups    = [string:tokens(G, [$ ]) || 
19477:                                            G <- NetstatGroups0],
19478:                     MAddrs           = [WhichMAddr(NetstatGroup) || 
19479:                                            NetstatGroup <- NetstatGroups],
19480:                     which_multicast_address3(Domain, MAddrs)
19481:                 end
19482:             catch
19483:                 throw:E:_ ->
19484:                     throw(E);
19485:                 C:E:S ->
19486:                     not_supported({multicast, {C,E,S}})
19487:             end
19488:     end.
19489: 
19490: which_multicast_address3(_Domain, []) ->
19491:     not_supported({multicast, no_valid_addrs});
19492: which_multicast_address3(Domain, [MAddrStr|MAddrs]) ->
19493:     %% Even on linux some of these are not actually addresses, but
19494:     %% "host names", such as all-systems.mcast.net. But both
19495:     %% address strings, such as "224.0.0.251" and host name strings
19496:     %% gets translated into an address by the inet:inet:getaddr/2.
19497:     case inet:getaddr(MAddrStr, Domain) of
19498:         {ok, MAddr} ->
19499:             MAddr;
19500:         {error, _} ->
19501:             which_multicast_address3(Domain, MAddrs)
19502:     end.
19503:     
19504: which_local_host_ifname(Domain) ->
19505:     case ?SLIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
19506:         {ok, #{name := Name}} ->
19507:             Name;
19508:         {error, Reason} ->
19509:             not_supported({multicast, Reason})
19510:     end.
19511: 
19512:     
19513: 
19514: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19515: 
19516: %% Tests that the pktinfo control message header is received when
19517: %% setting the socket 'ip' option pktinfo is set to true when using
19518: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
19519: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
19520: %%
19521: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo, boolean()).
19522: %%
19523: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the pktinfo control message
19524: %% header will be with the message.
19525: %%
19526: %% Note that it *should* be possible to explicitly send pktinfo also,
19527: %% but this have not yet been implemented (in socket), so that part
19528: %% we do not test!!
19529: %%
19530: 
19531: api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
19532:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
19533:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
19534:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_ip_pktinfo() end,
19535:            fun() ->
19536:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
19537:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo, Value)
19538:                           end,
19539:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
19540:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo)
19541:                           end,
19542:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
19543:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
19544:                                           iov  => [Data]},
19545:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
19546:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
19547:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
19548:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
19549:                                            type  => pktinfo,
19550:                                            data  => Info},
19551:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
19552:                                            ctrl => [CMsg],
19553:                                            iov  => [Data]},
19554:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
19555:                           end,
19556:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
19557:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
19558:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
19559:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
19560:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
19561:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
19562:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
19563:                                           ERROR
19564:                                   end
19565:                           end,
19566:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
19567:                                  proto  => udp,
19568:                                  send   => Send,
19569:                                  recv   => Recv,
19570:                                  set    => Set,
19571:                                  get    => Get},
19572:                    ok = api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp(InitState)
19573:            end).
19574: 
19575: 
19576: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19577: 
19578: api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp(InitState) ->
19579:     Seq = 
19580:         [
19581:          #{desc => "local address",
19582:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
19583:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19584:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19585:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
19586:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
19587:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
