19588:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19589:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
19590:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
19591:                    end},
19592: 
19593:          #{desc => "open src socket",
19594:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19595:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19596:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
19597:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
19598:                    end},
19599:          #{desc => "bind src",
19600:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
19601:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19602:                                ok ->
19603:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
19604:                                    ok;
19605:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19606:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19607:                                    ERROR
19608:                            end
19609:                    end},
19610:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
19611:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
19612:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
19613:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
19614:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
19615:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
19616:                    end},
19617: 
19618:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
19619:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19620:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19621:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
19622:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
19623:                    end},
19624:          #{desc => "bind dst",
19625:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
19626:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19627:                                ok ->
19628:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
19629:                                    ok;
19630:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19631:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19632:                                    ERROR
19633:                            end
19634:                    end},
19635:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
19636:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
19637:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
19638:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
19639:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
19640:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
19641:                    end},
19642:          #{desc => "get default pktinfo for dst socket",
19643:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
19644:                            case Get(Sock) of
19645:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
19646:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl: ~p", [Value]),
19647:                                    ok;
19648:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
19649:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src pktinfo: ~p",
19650:                                                [Unexpected]),
19651:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
19652:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19653:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) pktinfo:"
19654:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19655:                                    ERROR
19656:                            end
19657:                    end},
19658: 
19659:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) pktinfo)",
19660:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19661:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
19662:                    end},
19663:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
19664:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19665:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19666:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19667:                                    ok;
19668:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
19669:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19670:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19671:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
19672:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19673:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
19674:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19675:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
19676:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
19677:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
19678:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
19679:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19680:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19681:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19682:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19683:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19684:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19685:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
19686:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
19687:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19688:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19689:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19690:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19691:                                    ERROR
19692:                            end
19693:                    end},
19694: 
19695: 
19696:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending pktinfo ***
19697: 
19698:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit pktinfo)",
19699:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19700:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, PktInfo)
19701:          %%           end},
19702:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo pktinfo",
19703:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19704:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
19705:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19706:          %%                           ok;
19707:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
19708:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19709:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19710:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
19711:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19712:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
19713:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19714:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
19715:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
19716:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
19717:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
19718:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19719:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
19720:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19721:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19722:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19723:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19724:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
19725:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
19726:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19727:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
19728:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
19729:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
19730:          %%                           ERROR
19731:          %%                   end
19732:          %%           end},
19733: 
19734:          #{desc => "enable pktinfo on dst socket",
19735:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
19736:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
19737:                                ok ->
19738:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst pktinfo enabled"),
19739:                                    ok;
19740:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19741:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting pktinfo:"
19742:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19743:                                    ERROR
19744:                            end
19745:                    end},
19746: 
19747:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit pktinfo)",
19748:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19749:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
19750:                    end},
19751:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default pktinfo",
19752:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19753:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19754:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
19755:                                              type  := pktinfo,
19756:                                              value := #{addr     := Addr,
19757:                                                         ifindex  := IfIdx,
19758:                                                         spec_dst := SpecDst}}],
19759:                                      ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19760:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Pkt Info: "
19761:                                                "~n   Addr:      ~p"
19762:                                                "~n   If Index:  ~p"
19763:                                                "~n   Spec Dst:  ~p",
19764:                                                [Addr, IfIdx, SpecDst]),
19765:                                    ok;
19766:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
19767:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19768:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19769:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
19770:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19771:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
19772:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19773:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
19774:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
19775:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
19776:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
19777:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19778:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19779:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19780:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19781:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19782:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19783:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
19784:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
19785:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19786:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19787:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19788:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19789:                                    ERROR
19790:                            end
19791:                    end},
19792: 
19793: 
19794:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending pktinfo ***
19795: 
19796:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit pktinfo)",
19797:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19798:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, PktInfo)
19799:          %%           end},
19800:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w ttl = 100",
19801:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19802:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
19803:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
19804:          %%                                     type  := ttl,
19805:          %%                                     data  := PktInfo}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19806:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("Got Pkt Info: "
19807:          %%                                       "~n   ~p", [Info]),
19808:          %%                           ok;
19809:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
19810:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19811:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19812:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
19813:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19814:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
19815:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19816:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
19817:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
19818:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
19819:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
19820:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19821:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
19822:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19823:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19824:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19825:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19826:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
19827:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
19828:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19829:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
19830:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
19831:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
19832:          %%                           ERROR
19833:          %%                   end
19834:          %%           end},
19835: 
19836:          #{desc => "close src socket",
19837:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
19838:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
19839:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
19840:                    end},
19841:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
19842:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
19843:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
19844:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
19845:                    end},
19846: 
19847:          %% *** We are done ***
19848:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
19849:         ],
19850:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
19851:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
19852: 
19853: 
19854: 
19855: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19856: 
19857: %% Tests that the options control message header is received when
19858: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvopts is set to true when using
19859: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
19860: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
19861: %%
19862: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvopts, boolean()).
19863: %%
19864: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the options control message
19865: %% header will be with the message.
19866: %%
19867: %% Note that it *should* be possible to explicitly send options also,
19868: %% but this have not yet been implemented (in socket), so that part
19869: %% we do not test!!
19870: %%
19871: %%
19872: %% <NOTE>
19873: %%
19874: %% This test does not currently work. The recvopts is supposed to
19875: %% result in a IP_OPTIONS control message header but does not!
19876: %% So, exactly how we are suppose to use this option is unknown.
19877: %% So, let the test code remain, but skip until we have figured out
19878: %% how to test this.
19879: %%
19880: %% </NOTE>
19881: %%
19882: 
19883: api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
19884:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
19885:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp4,
19886:            fun() ->
19887:                    has_support_ipv4(),
19888:                    has_support_ip_recvopts(),
19889:                    %% We also use the recvtos and timestamp options
19890:                    %% in this test, so at least one of them must
19891:                    %% be supported
19892:                    has_support_ip_recvtos_and_or_sock_timestamp(),
19893:                    not_yet_implemented()
19894: 
19895:            end,
19896:            fun() ->
19897:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
19898:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvopts, Value)
19899:                           end,
19900:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
19901:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvopts)
19902:                           end,
19903:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
19904:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
19905:                                              iov  => [Data]},
19906:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
19907:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
19908:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
19909:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
19910:                                               type  => options,
19911:                                               data  => Info},
19912:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
19913:                                               ctrl => [CMsg],
19914:                                               iov  => [Data]},
19915:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
19916:                           end,
19917:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
19918:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
19919:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
19920:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
19921:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
19922:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
19923:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
19924:                                           ERROR
19925:                                   end
19926:                           end,
19927:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
19928:                                  proto  => udp,
19929:                                  send   => Send,
19930:                                  recv   => Recv,
19931:                                  set    => Set,
19932:                                  get    => Get},
19933:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp(InitState)
19934:            end).
19935: 
19936: 
19937: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19938: 
19939: api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp(InitState) ->
19940:     Seq = 
19941:         [
19942:          %% Start by figure out which of the ip:recvtos and/or socket:timestamp
19943:          %% options we can use.
19944:          #{desc => "test for ip:recvtos",
19945:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
19946:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("test for ip:recvtos"),
19947:                            case socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvtos) of
19948:                                true ->
19949:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("use ip:recvtos"),
19950:                                    {ok, State#{recvtos => true}};
19951:                                false -> 
19952:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("do *not* use ip:recvtos"),
19953:                                    {ok, State#{recvtos => false}}
19954:                            end
19955:                    end},
19956:          #{desc => "test for socket:timestamp",
19957:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
19958:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("test for socket:timestamp"),
19959:                            case socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp) of
19960:                                true ->
19961:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("use socket:timestamp"),
19962:                                    {ok, State#{timestamp => true}};
19963:                                false -> 
19964:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("do *not* use socket:timestamp"),
19965:                                    {ok, State#{timestamp => false}}
19966:                            end
19967:                    end},
19968: 
19969:          #{desc => "local address",
19970:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
19971:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19972:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19973:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
19974:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
19975:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
19976:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19977:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
19978:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
19979:                    end},
19980: 
19981:          #{desc => "open src socket",
19982:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19983:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19984:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
19985:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
19986:                    end},
19987:          #{desc => "bind src",
19988:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
19989:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19990:                                ok ->
19991:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
19992:                                    ok;
19993:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19994:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19995:                                    ERROR
19996:                            end
19997:                    end},
19998:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
19999:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20000:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
20001:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
20002:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
20003:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
20004:                    end},
20005: 
20006:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
20007:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20008:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20009:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
20010:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
20011:                    end},
20012:          #{desc => "bind dst",
20013:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
20014:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20015:                                ok ->
20016:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
20017:                                    ok;
20018:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20019:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
20020:                                    ERROR
20021:                            end
20022:                    end},
20023:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
20024:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20025:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
20026:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
20027:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
20028:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
20029:                    end},
20030:          #{desc => "default recvopts for dst socket",
20031:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
20032:                            case Get(Sock) of
20033:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
20034:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvopts: ~p", [Value]),
20035:                                    ok;
20036:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
20037:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
20038:                                                [Unexpected]),
20039:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
20040:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20041:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
20042:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20043:                                    ERROR
20044:                            end
20045:                    end},
20046: 
20047:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) options)",
20048:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20049:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
20050:                    end},
20051:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
20052:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20053:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20054:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20055:                                    ok;
20056:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20057:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20058:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20059:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20060:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20061:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20062:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20063:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20064:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20065:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20066:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20067:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20068:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20069:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20070:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20071:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20072:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20073:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20074:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20075:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20076:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20077:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20078:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20079:                                    ERROR
20080:                            end
20081:                    end},
20082: 
20083: 
20084:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending options ***
20085: 
20086:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit options)",
20087:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20088:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Opts)
20089:          %%           end},
20090:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo options",
20091:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20092:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
20093:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20094:          %%                           ok;
20095:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20096:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20097:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20098:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20099:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20100:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20101:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20102:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20103:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
20104:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
20105:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20106:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20107:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
20108:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20109:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20110:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20111:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20112:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20113:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20114:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20115:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
20116:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
20117:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
20118:          %%                           ERROR
20119:          %%                   end
20120:          %%           end},
20121: 
20122:          #{desc => "enable recvopts on dst socket",
20123:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20124:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
20125:                                ok ->
20126:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvopts enabled"),
20127:                                    ok;
20128:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20129:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvopts:"
20130:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20131:                                    ERROR
20132:                            end
20133:                    end},
20134: 
20135:          %% This specific option, recvtos, is tested in another test case
20136:          %% Note that this may not actually be supported here!!
20137:          #{desc => "maybe enable ip:recvtos on dst socket",
20138:            cmd  => fun(#{recvtos := true, sock_dst := Sock} = _State) ->
20139:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("enable ip:recvtos"),
20140:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, true);
20141:                       (#{recvtos := false} = _State) ->
20142:                            ok
20143:                    end},
20144:          %% This specific option, timestamp, is tested in another test case
20145:          #{desc => "maybe enable socket:timestamp on dst socket",
20146:            cmd  => fun(#{timestamp := true, sock_dst := Sock} = _State) ->
20147:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("enable socket:timestamp"),
20148:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, true);
20149:                       (#{timestamp := false} = _State) ->
20150:                            ok
20151:                    end},
20152: 
20153:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit options)",
20154:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20155:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
20156:                    end},
20157:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default options",
20158:            cmd  => fun(#{recvtos := true, timestamp := true,
20159:                          sock_dst := Sock,
20160:                          sa_src   := Src,
20161:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
20162:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20163:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
20164:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 2) ->
20165:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
20166:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
20167:                                    ok;
20168:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20169:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20170:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20171:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20172:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20173:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20174:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20175:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20176:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20177:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20178:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20179:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20180:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20181:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20182:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20183:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20184:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20185:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20186:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20187:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20188:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20189:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20190:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20191:                                    ERROR
20192:                            end;
20193:                       (#{timestamp := true,
20194:                          sock_dst := Sock,
20195:                          sa_src   := Src,
20196:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
20197:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20198:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
20199:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 1) ->
20200:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
20201:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
20202:                                    ok;
20203:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20204:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20205:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20206:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20207:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20208:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20209:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20210:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20211:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20212:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20213:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20214:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20215:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20216:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20217:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20218:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20219:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20220:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20221:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20222:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20223:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20224:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20225:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20226:                                    ERROR
20227:                            end;
20228:                       (#{recvtos := true,
20229:                          sock_dst := Sock,
20230:                          sa_src   := Src,
20231:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
20232:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20233:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
20234:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 1) ->
20235:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
20236:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
20237:                                    ok;
20238:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20239:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20240:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20241:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20242:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20243:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20244:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20245:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20246:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20247:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20248:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20249:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20250:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20251:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20252:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20253:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20254:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20255:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20256:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20257:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20258:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20259:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20260:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20261:                                    ERROR
20262:                            end
20263:                    end},
20264: 
20265: 
20266:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending options ***
20267: 
20268:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit options)",
20269:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20270:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Opts)
20271:          %%           end},
20272:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w options",
20273:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20274:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
20275:          %%                       {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20276:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("Got Options: "
20277:          %%                                       "~n   ~p", [Opts]),
20278:          %%                           ok;
20279:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20280:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20281:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20282:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20283:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20284:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20285:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20286:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20287:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
20288:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
20289:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20290:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20291:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
20292:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20293:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20294:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20295:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20296:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20297:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20298:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20299:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
20300:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
20301:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
20302:          %%                           ERROR
20303:          %%                   end
20304:          %%           end},
20305: 
20306:          #{desc => "close src socket",
20307:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20308:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20309:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
20310:                    end},
20311:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
20312:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20313:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20314:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
20315:                    end},
20316: 
20317:          %% *** We are done ***
20318:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20319:         ],
20320:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
20321:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
20322: 
20323: 
20324: 
20325: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20326: 
20327: %% Tests that the origdstaddr control message header is received when
20328: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvorigdstaddr is set to true when
20329: %% using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
20330: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
20331: %%
20332: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr, boolean()).
20333: %%
20334: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the origdstaddr control
20335: %% message header will be with the message.
20336: %%
20337: %%
20338: 
20339: api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
20340:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
20341:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp4,
20342:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_ip_recvorigdstaddr() end,
20343:            fun() ->
20344:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
20345:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr, Value)
20346:                           end,
20347:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
20348:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr)
20349:                           end,
20350:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
20351:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
20352:                                              iov  => [Data]},
20353:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
20354:                           end,
20355:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
20356:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
20357:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
20358:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
20359:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
20360:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
20361:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
20362:                                           ERROR
20363:                                   end
20364:                           end,
20365:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
20366:                                  proto  => udp,
20367:                                  send   => Send,
20368:                                  recv   => Recv,
20369:                                  set    => Set,
20370:                                  get    => Get},
20371:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp(InitState)
20372:            end).
20373: 
20374: 
20375: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20376: 
20377: api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp(InitState) ->
20378:     Seq = 
20379:         [
20380:          #{desc => "local address",
20381:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
20382:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20383:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20384:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
20385:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
20386:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
20387:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20388:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
20389:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
20390:                    end},
20391: 
20392:          #{desc => "open src socket",
20393:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20394:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20395:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
20396:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
20397:                    end},
20398:          #{desc => "bind src",
20399:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
20400:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20401:                                ok ->
20402:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
20403:                                    ok;
20404:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20405:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
20406:                                    ERROR
20407:                            end
20408:                    end},
20409:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
20410:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20411:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
20412:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
20413:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
20414:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
20415:                    end},
20416: 
20417:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
20418:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20419:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20420:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
20421:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
20422:                    end},
20423:          #{desc => "bind dst",
20424:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
20425:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20426:                                ok ->
20427:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
20428:                                    ok;
20429:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20430:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
20431:                                    ERROR
20432:                            end
20433:                    end},
20434:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
20435:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20436:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
20437:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
20438:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
20439:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
20440:                    end},
20441:          #{desc => "get default recvorigdstaddr for dst socket",
20442:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
20443:                            case Get(Sock) of
20444:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
20445:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvorigdstaddr: ~p", [Value]),
20446:                                    ok;
20447:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
20448:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvorigdstaddr: ~p",
20449:                                                [Unexpected]),
20450:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
20451:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20452:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) "
20453:                                                "recvorigdstaddr:"
20454:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20455:                                    ERROR
20456:                            end
20457:                    end},
20458: 
20459:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (when recvorigdstaddr disabled)",
20460:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20461:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
20462:                    end},
20463:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo origdstaddr",
20464:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20465:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20466:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20467:                                    ok;
20468:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20469:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20470:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20471:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20472:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20473:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20474:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20475:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20476:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20477:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20478:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20479:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20480:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20481:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20482:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20483:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20484:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20485:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20486:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20487:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20488:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20489:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20490:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20491:                                    ERROR
20492:                            end
20493:                    end},
20494: 
20495:          #{desc => "enable recvorigdstaddr on dst socket",
20496:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20497:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
20498:                                ok ->
20499:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvorigdstaddr enabled"),
20500:                                    ok;
20501:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20502:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed enable recvorigdstaddr:"
20503:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20504:                                    ERROR
20505:                            end
20506:                    end},
20507: 
20508:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (when recvorigdstaddr enabled)",
20509:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20510:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
20511:                    end},
20512:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w origdstaddr",
20513:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20514:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20515:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
20516:                                              type  := origdstaddr,
20517:                                              value := Addr}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20518:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("got origdstaddr "
20519:                                                "control message header: "
20520:                                                "~n   ~p", [Addr]),
20521:                                    ok;
20522:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20523:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20524:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20525:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20526:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20527:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20528:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20529:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20530:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20531:                                                 [#{level => ip,
20532:                                                    type  => origdstaddr,
20533:                                                    data  => "something"}], BadCHdrs,
20534:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20535:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20536:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20537:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20538:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20539:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20540:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20541:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20542:                                                [Src,
20543:                                                 [#{level => ip,
20544:                                                    type  => origdstaddr,
20545:                                                    data  => "something"}],
20546:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20547:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20548:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20549:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20550:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20551:                                    ERROR
20552:                            end
20553:                    end},
20554: 
20555:          #{desc => "close src socket",
20556:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20557:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20558:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
20559:                    end},
20560:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
20561:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20562:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20563:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
20564:                    end},
20565: 
20566:          %% *** We are done ***
20567:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20568:         ],
20569:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
20570:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
20571: 
20572: 
20573: 
20574: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20575: 
20576: %% Tests that the tos control message header is received when
20577: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvtos is set to true when using
20578: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
20579: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
20580: %%
20581: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, boolean()).
20582: %%
20583: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the tos control message
20584: %% header will be with the message.
20585: %%
20586: %% On some platforms it works sending TOS with the message (sendmsg with 
20587: %% a control message header), but since its not universal, we can't use
20588: %% that method. Instead, set tos (true) on the sending socket.
20589: %%
20590: 
20591: api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
20592:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
20593:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp4,
20594:            fun() ->
20595:                    is_not_windows(), % IP_TOS on windows
20596:                    has_support_ipv4(),
20597:                    has_support_ip_recvtos(),
20598:                    has_support_ip_tos() % Used in the test
20599:            end,
20600:            fun() ->
20601:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
20602:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, Value)
20603:                           end,
20604:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
20605:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvtos)
20606:                           end,
20607:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
20608:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
20609:                                           iov  => [Data]},
20610:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
20611:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, TOS) ->
20612:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
20613:                                            type  => tos,
20614:                                            data  => TOS},
20615:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
20616:                                            ctrl => [CMsg],
20617:                                            iov  => [Data]},
20618:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
20619:                           end,
20620:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
20621:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
20622:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
20623:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
20624:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
20625:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
20626:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
20627:                                           ERROR
20628:                                   end
20629:                           end,
20630:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
20631:                                  proto  => udp,
20632:                                  send   => Send,
20633:                                  recv   => Recv,
20634:                                  set    => Set,
20635:                                  get    => Get},
20636:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp(InitState)
20637:            end).
20638: 
20639: 
20640: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20641: 
20642: api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp(InitState) ->
20643:     Seq = 
20644:         [
20645:          #{desc => "local address",
20646:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
20647:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20648:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20649:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
20650:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
20651:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
20652:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20653:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
20654:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
20655:                    end},
20656: 
20657:          #{desc => "open src socket",
20658:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20659:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20660:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
20661:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
20662:                    end},
20663:          #{desc => "bind src",
20664:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
20665:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20666:                                ok ->
20667:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
20668:                                    ok;
20669:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20670:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
20671:                                    ERROR
20672:                            end
20673:                    end},
20674:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
20675:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20676:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
20677:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
20678:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
20679:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
20680:                    end},
20681: 
20682:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
20683:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20684:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20685:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
20686:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
20687:                    end},
20688:          #{desc => "bind dst",
20689:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
20690:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20691:                                ok ->
20692:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
20693:                                    ok;
20694:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20695:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
20696:                                    ERROR
20697:                            end
20698:                    end},
20699:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
20700:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20701:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
20702:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
20703:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
20704:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
20705:                    end},
20706:          #{desc => "default recvtos for dst socket",
20707:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
20708:                            case Get(Sock) of
20709:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
20710:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos: ~p", [Value]),
20711:                                    ok;
20712:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
20713:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
20714:                                                [Unexpected]),
20715:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
20716:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20717:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
20718:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20719:                                    ERROR
20720:                            end
20721:                    end},
20722: 
20723:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tos)",
20724:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20725:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
20726:                    end},
20727:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
20728:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20729:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20730:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20731:                                    ok;
20732:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20733:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20734:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20735:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20736:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20737:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20738:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20739:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20740:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20741:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20742:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20743:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20744:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20745:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20746:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20747:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20748:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20749:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20750:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20751:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20752:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20753:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20754:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20755:                                    ERROR
20756:                            end
20757:                    end},
20758: 
20759:          #{desc => "set tos = reliability on src sock",
20760:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
20761:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, reliability)
20762:                    end},
20763:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w tos = reliability)",
20764:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
20765:                          sa_dst   := Dst,
20766:                          send     := Send}) ->
20767:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
20768:                    end},
20769: 
20770:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit tos = reliability)",
20771:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
20772:          %%                 sa_dst   := Dst,
20773:          %%                 send     := Send}) ->
20774:          %%                   socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
20775:          %%                   case Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, reliability) of
20776:          %%                       ok ->
20777:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
20778:          %%                           ok;
20779:          %%                       {error, Reason} ->
20780:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed sending message with tos: "
20781:          %%                                       "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
20782:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
20783:          %%                           {skip, "Failed sending message with TOS"}
20784:          %%                   end
20785:          %%           end},
20786: 
20787:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo explicit tos",
20788:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20789:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20790:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20791:                                    ok;
20792:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20793:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20794:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20795:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20796:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20797:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20798:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20799:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20800:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20801:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
20802:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20803:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20804:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20805:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20806:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20807:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20808:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20809:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20810:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20811:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20812:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20813:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20814:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20815:                                    ERROR
20816:                            end
20817:                    end},
20818: 
20819:          #{desc => "set tos = 0 on src sock (\"disabled\")",
20820:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
20821:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, 0)
20822:                    end},
20823: 
20824:          #{desc => "enable recvtos on dst socket",
20825:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20826:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
20827:                                ok ->
20828:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos enabled"),
20829:                                    ok;
20830:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20831:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvtos:"
20832:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20833:                                    ERROR
20834:                            end
20835:                    end},
20836: 
20837:          #{desc => "enable recvtos on dst socket",
20838:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20839:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
20840:                                ok ->
20841:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos enabled"),
20842:                                    ok;
20843:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20844:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvtos:"
20845:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20846:                                    ERROR
20847:                            end
20848:                    end},
20849: 
20850:          #{desc => "extract the (expected) recvtos \"default\" value",
20851:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20852:                            {ok, DefValue} = socket:getopt(Sock, ip, tos),
20853:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("(expected) recvtos def value: ~w",
20854:                                        [DefValue]),
20855:                            {ok, State#{dst_def_value => DefValue}}
20856:                    end},
20857: 
20858:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tos)",
20859:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20860:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
20861:                    end},
20862:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default tos",
20863:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst      := Sock,
20864:                          dst_def_value := DefValue,
20865:                          sa_src        := Src,
20866:                          recv          := Recv}) ->
20867:                            ExpCHdr1 = #{level => ip,
20868:                                         type  => tos,
20869:                                         value => DefValue,
20870:                                         data  => any},
20871:                            ExpCHdr2 = #{level => ip,
20872:                                         type  => recvtos,
20873:                                         value => DefValue,
20874:                                         data  => any},
20875:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20876:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
20877:                                              type  := TOS,
20878:                                              value := DefValue}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
20879:                                  when (TOS =:= tos) orelse
20880:                                       (TOS =:= recvtos) ->
20881:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("got default TOS (~w) "
20882:                                                "control message header", [TOS]),
20883:                                    ok;
20884:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
20885:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20886:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20887:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
20888:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:"
20889:                                                "~n     Alt 1:  ~p"
20890:                                                "~n     Alt 2:  ~p"
20891:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
20892:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20893:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
20894:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
20895:                                                 ExpCHdr1, ExpCHdr2, BadCHdrs,
20896:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
20897:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20898:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20899:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
20900:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
20901:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
20902:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
20903:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
20904:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
20905:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20906:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20907:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20908:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20909:                                    ERROR
20910:                            end
20911:                    end},
20912: 
20913:          #{desc => "set tos = reliability on src sock",
20914:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
20915:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, reliability)
20916:                    end},
20917:
