22344:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22345:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22346:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22347:                    end},
22348:          #{desc => "bind src",
22349:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22350:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22351:                                ok ->
22352:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22353:                                    ok;
22354:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22355:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22356:                                    ERROR
22357:                            end
22358:                    end},
22359:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22360:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22361:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22362:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22363:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22364:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22365:                    end},
22366: 
22367:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22368:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22369:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22370:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22371:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22372:                    end},
22373:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22374:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22375:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22376:                                ok ->
22377:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22378:                                    ok;
22379:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22380:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22381:                                    ERROR
22382:                            end
22383:                    end},
22384:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22385:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22386:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22387:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22388:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22389:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22390:                    end},
22391: 
22392:          #{desc => "enable options on dst socket",
22393:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := DSock,
22394: 			 sock_src := SSock,
22395: 			 opts     := Opts,
22396: 			 enable   := Enable} = _State) ->
22397: 			   %% If we fail to enable *any* of the options,
22398: 			   %% we give up.
22399: 			   E = fun({Level, Opt, _, _}) -> 
22400:                                        case Enable(DSock, Level, Opt) of
22401:                                            ok ->
22402:                                                ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [~w] ~w enabled",
22403:                                                            [Level, Opt]),
22404:                                                ok;
22405:                                            {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
22406:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected "
22407:                                                            "Failure: "
22408:                                                            "~p => SKIP",
22409:                                                            [Reason]),
22410:                                                (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22411:                                                (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22412:                                                {skip, Reason};
22413:                                            {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22414:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed "
22415:                                                            "setting ~w:"
22416:                                                            "   ~p",
22417:                                                            [Opt, Reason]),
22418:                                                throw(ERROR)
22419:                                        end
22420: 			       end,
22421: 			   lists:foreach(E, Opts),
22422: 			   ok
22423:                    end},
22424: 
22425:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
22426:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
22427: 			 sa_dst   := Dst,
22428: 			 opts     := Opts,
22429: 			 send     := Send}) ->
22430: 			   Hdrs = [{Level, Type, Data} ||
22431: 				      {Level, _, Type, Data} <- 
22432: 					  Opts, (Data =/= default)],
22433:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Hdrs)
22434:                    end},
22435:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22436:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock,
22437: 			 sa_src   := Src,
22438: 			 recv     := Recv,
22439: 			 opts     := Opts}) ->
22440:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22441:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}}
22442:                                  when length(CMsgs) =:= length(Opts)  ->
22443:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) cmsg headers: "
22444: 					       "~n   ~p", [CMsgs]),
22445: 				   %% We should really verify the headers:
22446: 				   %% values, types and so on...
22447:                                    ok;
22448:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22449:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22450:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22451:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22452:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22453:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22454:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22455:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22456:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22457:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
22458:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
22459: 						BadCHdrs,
22460: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22461:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22462:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22463:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22464:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22465:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22466:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22467:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22468:                                                [Src,
22469:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
22470:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
22471: 						?BASIC_REQ,
22472:                                                 UnexpData]),
22473:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22474:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22475:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22476:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22477:                                    ERROR
22478:                            end
22479:                    end},
22480: 
22481:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22482:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22483:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22484:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22485:                    end},
22486:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22487:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22488:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22489:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22490:                    end},
22491: 
22492:          %% *** We are done ***
22493:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
22494:         ],
22495:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
22496:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
22497: 
22498: 
22499: 
22500: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22501: 
22502: %% Tests that the IPv6 pktinfo control message header is received on
22503: %% incoming datagrams (UDP and RAW) when setting the socket 'ipv6'
22504: %% option recvpktinfo is set to true when using.
22505: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
22506: %%
22507: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo, boolean()).
22508: %%
22509: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the pktinfo control message
22510: %% header will be with the message.
22511: %%
22512: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
22513: %% although we only test this with dgram.
22514: %%
22515: 
22516: api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
22517:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
22518:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp6,
22519:            fun() ->
22520:                    has_support_ipv6(),
22521:                    has_support_ipv6_recvpktinfo()
22522:            end,
22523:            fun() ->
22524:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
22525:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo, Value)
22526:                           end,
22527:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
22528:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo)
22529:                           end,
22530:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
22531:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
22532:                                              iov  => [Data]},
22533:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
22534:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
22535:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
22536:                                   CMsg = #{level => ipv6,
22537:                                               type  => pktinfo,
22538:                                               data  => Info},
22539:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
22540:                                               ctrl => [CMsg],
22541:                                               iov  => [Data]},
22542:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
22543:                           end,
22544:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
22545:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
22546:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
22547:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
22548:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
22549:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
22550:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22551:                                           ERROR
22552:                                   end
22553:                           end,
22554:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
22555:                                  proto  => udp,
22556:                                  send   => Send,
22557:                                  recv   => Recv,
22558:                                  set    => Set,
22559:                                  get    => Get},
22560:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp(InitState)
22561:            end).
22562: 
22563: 
22564: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22565: 
22566: api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp(InitState) ->
22567:     Seq = 
22568:         [
22569:          #{desc => "local address",
22570:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
22571:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22572:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
22573:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
22574:                    end},
22575: 
22576:          #{desc => "open src socket",
22577:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22578:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22579:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22580:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22581:                    end},
22582:          #{desc => "bind src",
22583:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22584:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22585:                                ok ->
22586:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22587:                                    ok;
22588:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22589:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22590:                                    ERROR
22591:                            end
22592:                    end},
22593:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22594:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22595:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22596:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22597:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22598:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22599:                    end},
22600: 
22601:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22602:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22603:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22604:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22605:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22606:                    end},
22607:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22608:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22609:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22610:                                ok ->
22611:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22612:                                    ok;
22613:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22614:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22615:                                    ERROR
22616:                            end
22617:                    end},
22618:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22619:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22620:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22621:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22622:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22623:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22624:                    end},
22625:          #{desc => "default pktinfo for dst socket",
22626:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
22627:                            case Get(Sock) of
22628:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
22629:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl: ~p", [Value]),
22630:                                    ok;
22631:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
22632:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
22633:                                                [Unexpected]),
22634:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
22635:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22636:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) recvtos:"
22637:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22638:                                    ERROR
22639:                            end
22640:                    end},
22641: 
22642:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) pktinfo)",
22643:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22644:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22645:                    end},
22646:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22647:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22648:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22649:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22650:                                    ok;
22651:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22652:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22653:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22654:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22655:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22656:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22657:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22658:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22659:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22660:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22661:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22662:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22663:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22664:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22665:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22666:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22667:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22668:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22669:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22670:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22671:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22672:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22673:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22674:                                    ERROR
22675:                            end
22676:                    end},
22677: 
22678:          #{desc => "enable pktinfo on dst socket",
22679:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
22680:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
22681:                                ok ->
22682:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst pktinfo enabled"),
22683:                                    ok;
22684:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22685:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting pktinfo:"
22686:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22687:                                    ERROR
22688:                            end
22689:                    end},
22690: 
22691:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit pktinfo)",
22692:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22693:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22694:                    end},
22695:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default pktinfo",
22696:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22697:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22698:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
22699:                                              type  := pktinfo,
22700:                                              value := #{addr    := Addr,
22701:                                                         ifindex := IfIdx}}],
22702:                                      ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22703:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Pkt Info: "
22704:                                                "~n   Addr:      ~p"
22705:                                                "~n   If Index:  ~p",
22706:                                                [Addr, IfIdx]),
22707:                                    ok;
22708:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22709:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22710:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22711:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22712:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22713:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22714:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22715:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22716:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22717:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
22718:                                                   type  => pktinfo,
22719:                                                   value => "something"} , BadCHdrs,
22720:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22721:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22722:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22723:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22724:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22725:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22726:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22727:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22728:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22729:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22730:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22731:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22732:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22733:                                    ERROR
22734:                            end
22735:                    end},
22736: 
22737: 
22738:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22739:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22740:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22741:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22742:                    end},
22743:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22744:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22745:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22746:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22747:                    end},
22748: 
22749:          %% *** We are done ***
22750:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
22751:         ],
22752:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
22753:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
22754: 
22755: 
22756: 
22757: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22758: 
22759: %% Tests that the 'flow info' control message header is received when
22760: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' option flowinfo  is set to true when using
22761: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
22762: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
22763: %%
22764: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo, boolean()).
22765: %%
22766: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'flow info' control message
22767: %% header will be with the message.
22768: %%
22769: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
22770: %% although we only test this with dgram.
22771: %%
22772: %% There seem to be some weirdness with the definition of this
22773: %% option, so its defined in an include file we don't include
22774: %% (directly or indirectly). And since some of the defines
22775: %% occur in a file we *do* include (via netinet/in.h), we
22776: %% leave it as is for now...
22777: %%
22778: 
22779: api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
22780:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
22781:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp6,
22782:            fun() ->
22783:                    has_support_ipv6(),
22784:                    has_support_ipv6_flowinfo()
22785:            end,
22786:            fun() ->
22787:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
22788:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo, Value)
22789:                           end,
22790:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
22791:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo)
22792:                           end,
22793:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
22794:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
22795:                                              iov  => [Data]},
22796:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
22797:                           end,
22798:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
22799:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
22800:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
22801:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
22802:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
22803:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
22804:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22805:                                           ERROR
22806:                                   end
22807:                           end,
22808:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
22809:                                  proto  => udp,
22810:                                  send   => Send,
22811:                                  recv   => Recv,
22812:                                  set    => Set,
22813:                                  get    => Get},
22814:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp(InitState)
22815:            end).
22816: 
22817: 
22818: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22819: 
22820: api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp(InitState) ->
22821:     Seq = 
22822:         [
22823:          #{desc => "local address",
22824:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
22825:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22826:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
22827:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
22828:                    end},
22829: 
22830:          #{desc => "open src socket",
22831:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22832:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22833:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22834:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22835:                    end},
22836:          #{desc => "bind src",
22837:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22838:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22839:                                ok ->
22840:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22841:                                    ok;
22842:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22843:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22844:                                    ERROR
22845:                            end
22846:                    end},
22847:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22848:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22849:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22850:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22851:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22852:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22853:                    end},
22854: 
22855:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22856:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22857:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22858:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22859:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22860:                    end},
22861:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22862:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22863:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22864:                                ok ->
22865:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22866:                                    ok;
22867:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22868:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22869:                                    ERROR
22870:                            end
22871:                    end},
22872:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22873:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22874:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22875:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22876:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22877:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22878:                    end},
22879:          #{desc => "default flowinfo for dst socket",
22880:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
22881:                            case Get(Sock) of
22882:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
22883:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst flowinfo: ~p", [Value]),
22884:                                    ok;
22885:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
22886:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src flowinfo: ~p",
22887:                                                [Unexpected]),
22888:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
22889:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22890:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) flowinfo:"
22891:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22892:                                    ERROR
22893:                            end
22894:                    end},
22895: 
22896:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
22897:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22898:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
22899:                    end},
22900:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22901:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22902:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22903:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22904:                                    ok;
22905:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22906:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22907:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22908:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22909:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22910:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22911:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22912:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22913:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22914:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22915:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22916:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22917:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22918:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22919:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22920:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22921:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22922:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22923:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22924:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22925:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22926:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22927:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22928:                                    ERROR
22929:                            end
22930:                    end},
22931: 
22932:          #{desc => "enable flowinfo on dst socket",
22933:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
22934:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
22935:                                ok ->
22936:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst flowinfo enabled"),
22937:                                    ok;
22938:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22939:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting flowinfo:"
22940:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22941:                                    ERROR
22942:                            end
22943:                    end},
22944: 
22945:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
22946:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22947:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
22948:                    end},
22949:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22950:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22951:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22952:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
22953:                                              type  := flowinfo,
22954:                                              value := FlowID}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22955:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got flow info: "
22956: 					       "~n   Flow ID: ~p", [FlowID]),
22957:                                    ok;
22958:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22959:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22960:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22961:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22962:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22963:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22964:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22965:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22966:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22967:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
22968: 						  type  => flowinfo,
22969: 						  value => "something"},
22970: 						BadCHdrs,
22971: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22972:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22973:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22974:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22975:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22976:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22977:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22978:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22979:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22980:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22981:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22982:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22983:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22984:                                    ERROR
22985:                            end
22986:                    end},
22987: 
22988:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22989:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22990:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22991:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22992:                    end},
22993:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22994:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22995:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22996:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22997:                    end},
22998: 
22999:          %% *** We are done ***
23000:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23001:         ],
23002:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23003:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23004: 
23005: 
23006: 
23007: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23008: 
23009: %% Tests that the 'hop limit' control message header is received when
23010: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' hoplimit or recvhoplimit option is set to 
23011: %% true when using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
23012: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
23013: %%
23014: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvhoplimit | hoplimit, boolean()).
23015: %%
23016: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'hop limit' control message
23017: %% header will be with the message.
23018: %% We make the assumption, that if 'recvhoplimit' is supported, then
23019: %% that option is used to order the hoplimit control message, otherwise
23020: %% hoplimit is used.
23021: %%
23022: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
23023: %% although we only test this with dgram.
23024: %%
23025: %% <Note>
23026: %%
23027: %% There is also an IPV6_RECVHOPLIMIT option defined in the header
23028: %% file (bits/in.h) with a different value. This is not mentioned
23029: %% in the man page. Deprecated? More testing needed...
23030: %%
23031: %% </Note>
23032: %%
23033: 
23034: api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
23035:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23036:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp6,
23037:            fun() ->
23038:                    has_support_ipv6(),
23039:                    has_support_ipv6_hoplimit_or_recvhoplimit(),
23040: 		   is_good_enough_darwin({9,8,0}),
23041:                    is_good_enough_montavista("4.0.1")
23042:            end,
23043:            fun() ->
23044: 		   %% Begin by choosing which of the options we shall use
23045: 		   Opt = case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvhoplimit) of
23046: 			     true  -> recvhoplimit;
23047: 			     false -> hoplimit
23048: 			 end,
23049:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
23050: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try set ~p: ~p", [Opt, Value]),
23051:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt, Value)
23052:                           end,
23053:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
23054: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try get ~p", [Opt]),
23055:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt)
23056:                           end,
23057:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
23058:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
23059:                                              iov  => [Data]},
23060:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
23061:                           end,
23062:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
23063:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
23064:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
23065:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
23066:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
23067:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
23068:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
23069:                                           ERROR
23070:                                   end
23071:                           end,
23072:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
23073:                                  proto  => udp,
23074:                                  send   => Send,
23075:                                  recv   => Recv,
23076:                                  set    => Set,
23077:                                  get    => Get},
23078:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp(InitState)
23079:            end).
23080: 
23081: 
23082: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23083: 
23084: api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp(InitState) ->
23085:     Seq = 
23086:         [
23087:          #{desc => "local address",
23088:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
23089:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
23090:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
23091:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
23092:                    end},
23093: 
23094:          #{desc => "open src socket",
23095:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23096:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23097:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23098:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
23099:                    end},
23100:          #{desc => "bind src",
23101:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
23102:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23103:                                ok ->
23104:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23105:                                    ok;
23106:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23107:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23108:                                    ERROR
23109:                            end
23110:                    end},
23111:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
23112:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23113:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
23114:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
23115:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
23116:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
23117:                    end},
23118: 
23119:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
23120:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23121:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23122:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23123:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
23124:                    end},
23125:          #{desc => "bind dst",
23126:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
23127:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23128:                                ok ->
23129:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23130:                                    ok;
23131:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23132:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23133:                                    ERROR
23134:                            end
23135:                    end},
23136:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
23137:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23138:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
23139:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
23140:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
23141:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
23142:                    end},
23143:          #{desc => "default [recv]hoplimit for dst socket",
23144:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
23145:                            case Get(Sock) of
23146:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
23147:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]hoplimit: ~p",
23148: 					       [Value]),
23149:                                    ok;
23150:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23151:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src [recv]hoplimit: ~p",
23152:                                                [Unexpected]),
23153:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23154:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
23155:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
23156:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
23157:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
23158:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
23159:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23160:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
23161: 								      State))),
23162:                                    {skip, Reason};
23163:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23164:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) hoplimit:"
23165:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23166:                                    ERROR
23167:                            end
23168:                    end},
23169: 
23170:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
23171:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23172:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
23173:                    end},
23174:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23175:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23176:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23177:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
23178:                                    ok;
23179:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23180:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23181:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23182:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23183:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23184:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23185:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23186:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23187:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23188:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
23189:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23190:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23191:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23192:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23193:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23194:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23195:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23196:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23197:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23198:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23199:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23200:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23201:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23202:                                    ERROR
23203:                            end
23204:                    end},
23205: 
23206:          #{desc => "enable [recv]hoplimit on dst socket",
23207:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = State) ->
23208:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
23209:                                ok ->
23210:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]hoplimit enabled"),
23211:                                    ok;
23212:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
23213:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
23214:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
23215:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
23216:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
23217:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23218:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
23219: 								      State))),
23220:                                    {skip, Reason};
23221:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23222:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting hoplimit:"
23223:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23224:                                    ERROR
23225:                            end
23226:                    end},
23227: 
23228:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit ttl)",
23229:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23230:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
23231:                    end},
23232:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23233:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23234:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23235:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
23236:                                              type  := hoplimit,
23237:                                              value := HL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23238:                                  when is_integer(HL) ->
23239:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got hop limit: "
23240: 					       "~n   Hop Limit: ~p", [HL]),
23241:                                    ok;
23242:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23243:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23244:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23245:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23246:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23247:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23248:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23249:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23250:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23251:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
23252: 						  type  => hoplimit,
23253: 						  value => "something"},
23254: 						BadCHdrs,
23255: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23256:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23257:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23258:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23259:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23260:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23261:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23262:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23263:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
23264: 						       type  => hoplimit,
23265: 						       value => "something"},
23266: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23267:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23268:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23269:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23270:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23271:                                    ERROR
23272:                            end
23273:                    end},
23274: 
23275:          #{desc => "close src socket",
23276:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23277:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23278:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
23279:                    end},
23280:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
23281:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23282:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23283:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
23284:                    end},
23285: 
23286:          %% *** We are done ***
23287:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23288:         ],
23289:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23290:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23291: 
23292: 
23293: 
23294: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23295: 
23296: %% Tests that the 'tclass' control message header is received when
23297: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' tclass or recvtclass option is set to 
23298: %% true when using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
23299: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
23300: %%
23301: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvtclass | tclass, boolean()).
23302: %%
23303: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'tclass' control message
23304: %% header will be with the message.
23305: %% We make the assumption, that if 'recvtclass' is supported, then
23306: %% that option is used to order the tclass control message, otherwise
23307: %% tclass is used.
23308: %%
23309: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
23310: %% although we only test this with dgram.
23311: %%
23312: %% <Note>
23313: %%
23314: %% There is also an IPV6_RECVTCLASS option defined in the header
23315: %% file (bits/in.h) with a different value. This is not mentioned
23316: %% in the man page. Deprecated? More testing needed...
23317: %%
23318: %% </Note>
23319: %%
23320: 
23321: api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
23322:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23323:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp6,
23324:            fun() ->
23325:                    has_support_ipv6(),
23326:                    has_support_ipv6_tclass_or_recvtclass()
23327:            end,
23328:            fun() ->
23329: 		   %% Begin by choosing which of the options we shall use
23330: 		   Opt = case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvtclass) of
23331: 			     true  -> recvtclass;
23332: 			     false -> tclass
23333: 			 end,
23334:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
23335: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try set ~p: ~p", [Opt, Value]),
23336:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt, Value)
23337:                           end,
23338:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
23339: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try get ~p", [Opt]),
23340:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt)
23341:                           end,
23342:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
23343:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
23344:                                              iov  => [Data]},
23345:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
23346: 			     (Sock, Data, Dest, TC) ->
23347:                                   TCHdr    = #{level => ipv6,
23348: 					       type  => tclass,
23349: 					       data  => TC},
23350: 				  CMsgs = [TCHdr],
23351:                                   Msg   = #{addr => Dest,
23352: 					       ctrl => CMsgs,
23353: 					       iov  => [Data]},
23354:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
23355:                           end,
23356:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
23357:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
23358:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
23359:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
23360:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
23361:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
23362:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
23363:                                           ERROR
23364:                                   end
23365:                           end,
23366:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
23367:                                  proto  => udp,
23368:                                  send   => Send,
23369:                                  recv   => Recv,
23370:                                  set    => Set,
23371:                                  get    => Get},
23372:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp(InitState)
23373:            end).
23374: 
23375: 
23376: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23377: 
23378: api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp(InitState) ->
23379:     Seq = 
23380:         [
23381:          #{desc => "local address",
23382:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
23383:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
23384:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
23385:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
23386:                    end},
23387: 
23388:          #{desc => "open src socket",
23389:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23390:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23391:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23392:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
23393:                    end},
23394:          #{desc => "bind src",
23395:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
23396:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23397:                                ok ->
23398:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23399:                                    ok;
23400:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23401:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23402:                                    ERROR
23403:                            end
23404:                    end},
23405:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
23406:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23407:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
23408:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
23409:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
23410:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
23411:                    end},
23412: 
23413:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
23414:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23415:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23416:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23417:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
23418:                    end},
23419:          #{desc => "bind dst",
23420:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
23421:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23422:                                ok ->
23423:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23424:                                    ok;
23425:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23426:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23427:                                    ERROR
23428:                            end
23429:                    end},
23430:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
23431:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23432:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
23433:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
23434:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
23435:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
23436:                    end},
23437:          #{desc => "default [recv]tclass for dst socket",
23438:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
23439:                            case Get(Sock) of
23440:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
23441:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]tclass: ~p",
23442: 					       [Value]),
23443:                                    ok;
23444:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23445:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src [recv]tclass: ~p",
23446:                                                [Unexpected]),
23447:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23448:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
23449:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
23450:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
23451:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
23452:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
23453:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23454:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
23455: 								      State))),
23456:                                    {skip, Reason};
23457:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23458:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tclass:"
23459:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23460:                                    ERROR
23461:                            end
23462:                    end},
23463: 
23464:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
23465:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23466:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
23467:                    end},
23468:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23469:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23470:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23471:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
23472:                                    ok;
23473:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23474:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23475:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23476:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23477:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23478:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23479:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23480:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23481:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23482:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
23483:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23484:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23485:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23486:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23487:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23488:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23489:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23490:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23491:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23492:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23493:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23494:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23495:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23496:                                    ERROR
23497:                            end
23498:                    end},
23499: 
23500:          #{desc => "enable [recv]tclass on dst socket",
23501:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = State) ->
23502:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
23503:                                ok ->
23504:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]tclass enabled"),
23505:                                    ok;
23506:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
23507:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
23508:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
23509:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
23510:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
23511:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23512:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
23513: 								      State))),
23514:                                    {skip, Reason};
23515:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23516:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tclass:"
23517:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23518:                                    ERROR
23519:                            end
23520:                    end},
23521: 
23522:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tc)",
23523:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23524:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
23525:                    end},
23526:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23527:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23528:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23529:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
23530:                                              type  := tclass,
23531:                                              value := TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23532: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
23533:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got tclass: "
23534: 					       "~n   TClass: ~p", [TClass]),
23535:                                    ok;
23536:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23537:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23538:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23539:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23540:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23541:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23542:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23543:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23544:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23545:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
23546: 						  type  => tclass,
23547: 						  value => "something"},
23548: 						BadCHdrs,
23549: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23550:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23551:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23552:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23553:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23554:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23555:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23556:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23557:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
23558: 						       type  => tclass,
23559: 						       value => "something"},
23560: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23561:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23562:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23563:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23564:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23565:                                    ERROR
23566:                            end
23567:                    end},
23568: 
23569:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit tc = 1)",
23570:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23571:                            case Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, 1) of
23572:                                {error,
23573:                                 {get_overlapped_result,
23574:                                  #{file     := File,
23575:                                    function := Function,
23576:                                    line     := Line,
23577:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
23578:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
23579:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
23580:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
23581:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
23582:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
23583:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
23584:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
23585:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
23586:                                                [Info,
23587:                                                 File, Function, Line,
23588:                                                 RawInfo]),
23589:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23590:                                    {skip,
23591:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
23592:                                {error, {get_overlapped_result,
23593:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
23594:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
23595:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
23596:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
23597:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23598:                                    {skip,
23599:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
23600: 
23601:                                {error,
23602:                                 {completion_status,
23603:                                  #{file     := File,
23604:                                    function := Function,
23605:                                    line     := Line,
23606:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
23607:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
23608:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
23609:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
23610:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
23611:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
23612:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
23613:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
23614:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
23615:                                                [Info,
23616:                                                 File, Function, Line,
23617:                                                 RawInfo]),
23618:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23619:                                    {skip,
23620:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
23621:                                {error, {completion_status,
23622:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
23623:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
23624:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
23625:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
23626:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
23627:                                    {skip,
23628:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
23629: 
23630:                                Other ->
23631:                                    Other
23632:                            end
23633:                    end},
23634:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23635:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23636:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23637:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
23638:                                              type  := tclass,
23639:                                              value := 1 = TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23640: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
23641:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) tclass: "
23642: 					       "~n   TClass: ~p", [TClass]),
23643:                                    ok;
23644:                                {ok, {_Src, [#{level := ipv6,
23645: 					      type  := tclass,
23646: 					      value := TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23647: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
23648:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tclass: "
23649:                                                "~n   Expect TClass: ~p"
23650:                                                "~n   Recv TClass:   ~p",
23651:                                                [1, TClass]),
23652:                                    {error, {unexpected_tclass, TClass}};
23653:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23654:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23655:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23656:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23657:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23658:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23659:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23660:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23661:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23662:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
23663: 						  type  => tclass,
23664: 						  value => "something"},
23665: 						BadCHdrs,
23666: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23667:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23668:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23669:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23670:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23671:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23672:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23673:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23674:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
23675: 						       type  => tclass,
23676: 						       value => "something"},
23677: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23678:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23679: 
23680:                                 {error, _} = ERROR ->
23681:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23682:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23683:                                    ERROR
23684:                            end
23685:                    end},
23686: 
23687:          #{desc => "close src socket",
23688:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23689:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23690:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
23691:                    end},
23692:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
23693:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23694:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23695:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
23696:                    end},
23697: 
23698:          %% *** We are done ***
23699:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23700:         ],
23701:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23702:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23703: 
23704: 
23705: 
23706: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23707: 
23708: %% This intended to test "all" of the (currently) supported IPv6
23709: %% options that results in control message header(s).
23710: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
23711: %%
23712: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Flag, boolean()).
23713: %%
23714: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, a control message header
23715: %% for each of the enabled options will be received with the message.
23716: %%
23717: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
23718: %% although we only test this with dgram.
23719: %%
23720: %% Currently we *try* to use the following opts:
23721: %%
23722: %%      recvpktinfo | pktinfo   => pktinfo
23723: %%      flowinfo                => flowinfo
23724: %%      recvhoplimit | hoplimit => hoplimit
23725: %%      recvtclass | tclass     => tclass
23726: %%
23727: %%
23728: %% Every time we add a test case for a new option (that results in
23729: %% a control message hedare), we should also add it here.
23730: %%
23731: %% Even though this is a IPv6 test case, we add the 'socket' timestamp
23732: %% option (just to fill up), but in the test to see if we should run
23733: %% the test (since its a IPv6 test case).
23734: %%
23735: 
23736: api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
23737:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23738:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp6,
23739:            fun() ->
23740:                    has_support_ipv6(),
23741:                    Opts =
23742:                        [{ipv6, recvpktinfo},
23743:                         {ipv6, flowinfo},
23744:                         {ipv6, recvhoplimit},
23745:                         {ipv6, hoplimit}] ++
23746:                        case os:type() of
23747:                            {win32, nt} ->
23748:                                [];
23749:                            _ ->
23750:                                [{ipv6, recvtclass},
23751:                                 {ipv6, tclass}]
23752:                        end,
23753: 		   case is_any_options_supported(Opts) of
23754: 		       true ->
23755: 			   ok;
23756: 		       false ->
23757: 			   skip("None of the needed options are supported")
23758: 		   end,
23759: 		   %% The problem here is hoplimit on darwin 9.8.0,
23760: 		   %% but I can't be bothered to adjust the test case,
23761: 		   %% just skip on that machine (there is only one)...
23762: 		   is_good_enough_darwin({9,8,0}),
23763:                    is_good_enough_montavista("4.0.1")
23764:            end,
23765:            fun() ->
23766: 		   %% If we get this far, we *know* that at least one of the
23767: 		   %% options are available.
23768: 
23769: 		   %% This is list of all the options and there resulting
23770: 		   %% control message header type(s):
23771: 		   %%   [{'ipv6 socket option', 'control message header type'}]
23772: 		   Opts =
23773: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp) of
23774: 			   true ->
23775: 			       [{socket, timestamp, timestamp, default}];
23776: 			   false ->
23777: 			       []
