23778: 		       end ++
23779: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvpktinfo) of
23780: 			   true ->
23781: 			       [{ipv6, recvpktinfo, pktinfo, default}];
23782: 			   false ->
23783: 			       []
23784: 		       end ++
23785: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, flowinfo) of
23786: 			   true ->
23787: 			       [{ipv6, flowinfo, flowinfo, default}];
23788: 			   false ->
23789: 			       []
23790: 		       end ++
23791: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvhoplimit) of
23792: 			   true ->
23793: 			       [{ipv6, recvhoplimit, hoplimit, default}];
23794: 			   false ->
23795: 			       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, hoplimit) of
23796: 				   true ->
23797: 				       [{ipv6, hoplimit, hoplimit, default}];
23798: 				   false ->
23799: 				       []
23800: 			       end
23801: 		       end ++
23802:                        case os:type() of
23803:                            {win32, nt} ->
23804:                                [];
23805:                            _ ->
23806:                                case socket:is_supported(options,
23807:                                                         ipv6, recvtclass) of
23808:                                    true ->
23809:                                        [{ipv6, recvtclass, tclass, 42}];
23810:                                    false ->
23811:                                        case socket:is_supported(options,
23812:                                                                 ipv6, tclass) of
23813:                                            true ->
23814:                                                [{ipv6, tclass, tclass, 42}];
23815:                                            false ->
23816:                                                []
23817:                                        end
23818:                                end
23819: 		       end,
23820: 
23821:                    Enable = fun(Sock, Level, Opt) ->
23822: 				    ?SEV_IPRINT("try enable [~w] ~p",
23823:                                                 [Level, Opt]),
23824: 				    socket:setopt(Sock, Level, Opt, true)
23825:                             end,
23826:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, []) ->
23827:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
23828:                                              iov  => [Data]},
23829:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
23830: 			     (Sock, Data, Dest, Hdrs) when is_list(Hdrs) ->
23831: 				  CMsgs = [#{level => Level,
23832:                                              type  => Type,
23833:                                              data  => Val} ||
23834:                                               {Level, Type, Val} <- Hdrs],
23835:                                   Msg   = #{addr => Dest,
23836:                                             ctrl => CMsgs,
23837:                                             iov  => [Data]},
23838:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
23839:                           end,
23840:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
23841:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
23842:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
23843:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
23844:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
23845:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
23846:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
23847:                                           ERROR
23848:                                   end
23849:                           end,
23850:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
23851:                                  proto  => udp,
23852: 				 opts   => Opts,
23853:                                  send   => Send,
23854:                                  recv   => Recv,
23855:                                  enable => Enable},
23856:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp(InitState)
23857:            end).
23858: 
23859: 
23860: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23861: 
23862: api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp(InitState) ->
23863:     Seq = 
23864:         [
23865:          #{desc => "local address",
23866:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
23867:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
23868:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
23869:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
23870:                    end},
23871: 
23872:          #{desc => "open src socket",
23873:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23874:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23875:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23876:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
23877:                    end},
23878:          #{desc => "bind src",
23879:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
23880:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23881:                                ok ->
23882:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23883:                                    ok;
23884:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23885:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23886:                                    ERROR
23887:                            end
23888:                    end},
23889:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
23890:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23891:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
23892:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
23893:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
23894:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
23895:                    end},
23896: 
23897:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
23898:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23899:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
23900:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
23901:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
23902:                    end},
23903:          #{desc => "bind dst",
23904:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
23905:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23906:                                ok ->
23907:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
23908:                                    ok;
23909:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23910:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23911:                                    ERROR
23912:                            end
23913:                    end},
23914:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
23915:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23916:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
23917:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
23918:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
23919:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
23920:                    end},
23921: 
23922:          #{desc => "enable options on dst socket",
23923:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := DSock,
23924: 			 sock_src := SSock,
23925: 			 opts     := Opts,
23926: 			 enable   := Enable} = _State) ->
23927: 			   %% If we fail to enable *any* of the options,
23928: 			   %% we give up.
23929: 			   E = fun({Level, Opt, _, _}) -> 
23930:                                        case Enable(DSock, Level, Opt) of
23931:                                            ok ->
23932:                                                ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [~w] ~w enabled",
23933:                                                            [Level, Opt]),
23934:                                                ok;
23935:                                            {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
23936:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected "
23937:                                                            "Failure: "
23938:                                                            "~p => SKIP",
23939:                                                            [Reason]),
23940:                                                (catch socket:close(DSock)),
23941:                                                (catch socket:close(SSock)),
23942:                                                {skip, Reason};
23943:                                            {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23944:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed "
23945:                                                            "setting ~w:"
23946:                                                            "   ~p",
23947:                                                            [Opt, Reason]),
23948:                                                throw(ERROR)
23949:                                        end
23950: 			       end,
23951: 			   lists:foreach(E, Opts),
23952: 			   ok
23953:                    end},
23954: 
23955:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
23956:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
23957: 			 sa_dst   := Dst,
23958: 			 opts     := Opts,
23959: 			 send     := Send}) ->
23960: 			   Hdrs = [{Level, Type, Data} ||
23961: 				      {Level, _, Type, Data} <- 
23962: 					  Opts, (Data =/= default)],
23963:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Hdrs)
23964:                    end},
23965:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
23966:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock,
23967: 			 sa_src   := Src,
23968: 			 recv     := Recv,
23969: 			 opts     := Opts}) ->
23970:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23971:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}}
23972:                                  when length(CMsgs) =:= length(Opts)  ->
23973:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) cmsg headers: "
23974: 					       "~n   ~p", [CMsgs]),
23975: 				   %% We should really verify the headers:
23976: 				   %% values, types and so on...
23977:                                    ok;
23978:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23979:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23980:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23981:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23982:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23983:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23984:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23985:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23986:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23987:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
23988:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
23989: 						BadCHdrs,
23990: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23991:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23992:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23993:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23994:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23995:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23996:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23997:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23998:                                                [Src,
23999:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
24000:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
24001: 						?BASIC_REQ,
24002:                                                 UnexpData]),
24003:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24004:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24005:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24006:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24007:                                    ERROR
24008:                            end
24009:                    end},
24010: 
24011:          #{desc => "close src socket",
24012:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24013:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24014:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
24015:                    end},
24016:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
24017:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24018:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24019:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
24020:                    end},
24021: 
24022:          %% *** We are done ***
24023:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24024:         ],
24025:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
24026:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
24027: 
24028: 
24029: 
24030: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24031: 
24032: %% Tests that the congestion tcp socket option.
24033: %%
24034: %% According to the man page (on linux) for this option it *should* be
24035: %% possible to both get and set *allowed* algorithms. But when we attempt
24036: %% to set, we get 'enoent'.
24037: %% According to /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_allowed_congestion_control that
24038: %% allgorithm was allowed, so...
24039: %% For now, we only test that we can get (it could be a bug in our code)
24040: 
24041: api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24042:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24043:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp4,
24044:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_congestion() end,
24045:            fun() ->
24046:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_list(Value) ->
24047:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, congestion, Value)
24048:                           end,
24049:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24050:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, congestion)
24051:                           end,
24052:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24053:                                  proto  => tcp,
24054:                                  set    => Set,
24055:                                  get    => Get},
24056:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp(InitState)
24057:            end).
24058: 
24059: 
24060: 
24061: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24062: 
24063: api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp(InitState) ->
24064:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24065:     ServerSeq =
24066:         [
24067:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
24068:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
24069:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
24070:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
24071:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
24072:                    end},
24073:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
24074:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24075:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
24076:                            ok
24077:                    end},
24078: 
24079:          %% *** Init part ***
24080:          #{desc => "which local address",
24081:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24082:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24083:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24084:                    end},
24085:          #{desc => "create socket",
24086:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24087:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24088:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24089:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24090:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24091:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24092:                                    ERROR
24093:                            end
24094:                    end},
24095:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24096:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24097:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
24098:                                ok ->
24099:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
24100:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24101:                                    ok;
24102:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24103:                                    ERROR
24104:                            end
24105:                    end},
24106:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
24107:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24108:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
24109:                            ok
24110:                    end},
24111: 
24112: 
24113:          %% The actual test
24114:          #{desc => "await continue (get congestion)",
24115:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24116:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_congestion)
24117:                    end},
24118:          #{desc => "get congestion",
24119:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
24120:                            case Get(Sock) of
24121:                                {ok, Algorithm} ->
24122:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("algorithm: ~s", [Algorithm]),
24123:                                    {ok, State#{alg => Algorithm}};
24124:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24125:                                    ERROR
24126:                            end
24127:                    end},
24128:          #{desc => "announce ready (get congestion)",
24129:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24130:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_congestion),
24131:                            ok
24132:                    end},
24133: 
24134: 
24135:          %% *** Termination ***
24136:          #{desc => "await terminate",
24137:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
24138:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
24139:                                ok ->
24140:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
24141:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24142:                                    ERROR
24143:                            end
24144:                    end},
24145:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
24146:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
24147:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24148:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
24149:                    end},
24150: 
24151:          %% *** We are done ***
24152:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24153:         ],
24154: 
24155: 
24156:     TesterSeq =
24157:         [
24158:          %% *** Init part ***
24159:          #{desc => "monitor server",
24160:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24161:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
24162:                            ok
24163:                    end},
24164: 
24165:          %% Start the server
24166:          #{desc => "order server start",
24167:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24168:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
24169:                            ok
24170:                    end},
24171:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
24172:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24173:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
24174:                            ok
24175:                    end},
24176: 
24177:          %% *** The actual test ***
24178:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-congestion)",
24179:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24180:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_congestion),
24181:                            ok
24182:                    end},
24183:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-congestion)",
24184:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24185:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_congestion)
24186:                    end},
24187: 
24188: 
24189:          %% *** Termination ***
24190:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
24191:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24192:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
24193:                            ok
24194:                    end},
24195:          #{desc => "await server termination",
24196:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
24197:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
24198:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
24199:                            {ok, State1}
24200:                    end},
24201: 
24202:          %% *** We are done ***
24203:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24204:         ],
24205: 
24206: 
24207:     i("start server evaluator"),
24208:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
24209: 
24210:     i("start tester evaluator"),
24211:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
24212:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
24213: 
24214:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
24215: 
24216: 
24217: 
24218: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24219: 
24220: %% Tests that the cork tcp socket option.
24221: %%
24222: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
24223: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
24224: %%
24225: %% Reading the man page it seems like (on linux) that the
24226: %% value resets itself after some (short) time...
24227: 
24228: api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24229:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24230:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp4,
24231:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_cork() end,
24232:            fun() ->
24233:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
24234:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, cork, Value)
24235:                           end,
24236:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24237:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, cork)
24238:                           end,
24239:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24240:                                  proto  => tcp,
24241:                                  set    => Set,
24242:                                  get    => Get},
24243:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp(InitState)
24244:            end).
24245: 
24246: 
24247: 
24248: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24249: 
24250: api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp(InitState) ->
24251:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24252:     TesterSeq =
24253:         [
24254:          %% *** Init part ***
24255:          #{desc => "which local address",
24256:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24257:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24258:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24259:                    end},
24260:          #{desc => "create socket",
24261:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24262:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24263:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24264:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24265:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24266:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24267:                                    ERROR
24268:                            end
24269:                    end},
24270:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24271:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24272:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
24273:                                ok ->
24274:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
24275:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24276:                                    ok;
24277:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24278:                                    ERROR
24279:                            end
24280:                    end},
24281: 
24282: 
24283:          %% The actual test
24284:          #{desc => "get (default) cork (= false)",
24285:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24286:                            case Get(Sock) of
24287:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
24288:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork default: ~p", [Value]),
24289:                                    ok;
24290:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24291:                                    ERROR
24292:                            end
24293:                    end},
24294:          #{desc => "enable cork (=> true)",
24295:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
24296:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
24297:                                ok ->
24298:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork enabled"),
24299:                                    ok;
24300:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24301:                                    ERROR
24302:                            end
24303:                    end},
24304:          #{desc => "get cork (= true)",
24305:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24306:                            case Get(Sock) of
24307:                                {ok, true = Value} ->
24308:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork: ~p", [Value]),
24309:                                    ok;
24310:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24311:                                    ERROR
24312:                            end
24313:                    end},
24314: 
24315: 
24316:          %% *** Termination ***
24317:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
24318:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
24319:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24320:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
24321:                    end},
24322: 
24323:          %% *** We are done ***
24324:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24325:         ],
24326: 
24327:     i("start tester evaluator"),
24328:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
24329: 
24330:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
24331: 
24332: 
24333: 
24334: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24335: 
24336: %% Tests that the maxseg tcp socket option.
24337: %%
24338: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
24339: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
24340: %%
24341: %% Note that there is no point in reading this value back,
24342: %% since the kernel imposes its own rules with regard
24343: %% to what is an acceptable value.
24344: %%
24345: 
24346: api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24347:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24348:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
24349:            fun() ->
24350:                    has_support_ipv4(),
24351:                    has_support_tcp_maxseg()
24352:            end,
24353:            fun() ->
24354:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
24355:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, maxseg, Value)
24356:                           end,
24357:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24358:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, maxseg)
24359:                           end,
24360:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24361:                                  proto  => tcp,
24362:                                  set    => Set,
24363:                                  get    => Get},
24364:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp(InitState)
24365:            end).
24366: 
24367: 
24368: 
24369: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24370: 
24371: api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp(InitState) ->
24372:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24373:     TesterSeq =
24374:         [
24375:          %% *** Init part ***
24376:          #{desc => "which local address",
24377:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24378:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24379:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24380:                    end},
24381:          #{desc => "create socket",
24382:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24383:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24384:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24385:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24386:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24387:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24388:                                    ERROR
24389:                            end
24390:                    end},
24391:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24392:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24393:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
24394:                                ok ->
24395:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
24396:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24397:                                    ok;
24398:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24399:                                    ERROR
24400:                            end
24401:                    end},
24402: 
24403: 
24404:          %% The actual test
24405:          #{desc => "get (default) maxseg",
24406:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
24407:                            case Get(Sock) of
24408:                                {ok, DefMaxSeg} ->
24409:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("maxseg default: ~p", [DefMaxSeg]),
24410:                                    {ok, State#{def_maxseg => DefMaxSeg}};
24411:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
24412:                                    {skip, Reason};
24413:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24414:                                    ERROR
24415:                            end
24416:                    end},
24417:          
24418:          %% Note that there is no point in reading this value back,
24419:          %% since the kernel imposes its own rules with regard
24420:          %% to what is an acceptable value.
24421:          %% So, even if the set operation is a success, the value
24422:          %% still might not have changed.
24423:          %%
24424:          %% Note that not all platforms allow this to be set!
24425:          %% Since this is the *last* operation in the test sequence
24426:          %% (before termination) we also accept error reason = einval
24427:          %% as success (rather then skip).
24428:          %% The same goes for the error reason = enoprotoopt (Solaris).
24429:          #{desc => "(maybe) change maxseg (default + 16)",
24430:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
24431:                          set        := Set,
24432:                          def_maxseg := DefMaxSeg} = _State) ->
24433:                            NewMaxSeg = DefMaxSeg + 16,
24434:                            case Set(Sock, NewMaxSeg) of
24435:                                ok ->
24436:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("maxseg (maybe) changed (to ~w)",
24437:                                                [NewMaxSeg]),
24438:                                    ok;
24439:                                {error, Reason} when (Reason =:= einval) orelse
24440:                                                     (Reason =:= enoprotoopt) ->
24441:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("change not allowed (~w)",
24442:                                                [Reason]),
24443:                                    ok;
24444:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24445:                                    ERROR
24446:                            end
24447:                    end},
24448: 
24449:          %% *** Termination ***
24450:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
24451:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
24452:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24453:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
24454:                    end},
24455: 
24456:          %% *** We are done ***
24457:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24458:         ],
24459: 
24460:     i("start tester evaluator"),
24461:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
24462: 
24463:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
24464: 
24465: 
24466: 
24467: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24468: 
24469: %% Tests that the nodelay tcp socket option.
24470: %%
24471: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
24472: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
24473: 
24474: api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24475:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24476:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp4,
24477:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_nodelay() end,
24478:            fun() ->
24479:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
24480:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, nodelay, Value)
24481:                           end,
24482:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24483:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, nodelay)
24484:                           end,
24485:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24486:                                  proto  => tcp,
24487:                                  set    => Set,
24488:                                  get    => Get},
24489:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp(InitState)
24490:            end).
24491: 
24492: 
24493: 
24494: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24495: 
24496: api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp(InitState) ->
24497:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24498:     TesterSeq =
24499:         [
24500:          %% *** Init part ***
24501:          #{desc => "which local address",
24502:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24503:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24504:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24505:                    end},
24506:          #{desc => "create socket",
24507:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24508:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24509:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24510:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24511:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24512:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24513:                                    ERROR
24514:                            end
24515:                    end},
24516:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24517:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24518:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24519:                                ok ->
24520:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
24521:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24522:                                    ok;
24523:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24524:                                    ERROR
24525:                            end
24526:                    end},
24527: 
24528: 
24529:          %% The actual test
24530:          #{desc => "get (default) nodelay (= false)",
24531:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24532:                            case Get(Sock) of
24533:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
24534:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay default: ~p", [Value]),
24535:                                    ok;
24536:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24537:                                    ERROR
24538:                            end
24539:                    end},
24540:          #{desc => "enable nodelay (=> true)",
24541:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
24542:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
24543:                                ok ->
24544:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay enabled"),
24545:                                    ok;
24546:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24547:                                    ERROR
24548:                            end
24549:                    end},
24550:          #{desc => "get nodelay (= true)",
24551:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24552:                            case Get(Sock) of
24553:                                {ok, true = Value} ->
24554:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay: ~p", [Value]),
24555:                                    ok;
24556:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24557:                                    ERROR
24558:                            end
24559:                    end},
24560: 
24561: 
24562:          %% *** Termination ***
24563:          #{desc => "close socket",
24564:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
24565:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24566:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
24567:                    end},
24568: 
24569:          %% *** We are done ***
24570:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24571:         ],
24572: 
24573:     i("start tester evaluator"),
24574:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
24575: 
24576:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
24577: 
24578: 
24579: 
24580: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24581: 
24582: %% Tests that the keepcnt tcp socket option.
24583: %%
24584: %% "The maximum number of keepalive probes TCP should send before
24585: %%  dropping the connection"
24586: %%
24587: 
24588: api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24589:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24590:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
24591:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepcnt() end,
24592:            fun() ->
24593:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
24594:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepcnt, Value)
24595:                           end,
24596:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24597:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepcnt)
24598:                           end,
24599:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24600:                                  proto  => tcp,
24601:                                  set    => Set,
24602:                                  get    => Get},
24603:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp(InitState)
24604:            end).
24605: 
24606: 
24607: 
24608: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24609: 
24610: api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp(InitState) ->
24611:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24612:     ServerSeq =
24613:         [
24614:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
24615:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
24616:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
24617:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
24618:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
24619:                    end},
24620:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
24621:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24622:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
24623:                            ok
24624:                    end},
24625: 
24626:          %% *** Init part ***
24627:          #{desc => "which local address",
24628:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24629:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24630:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24631:                    end},
24632:          #{desc => "create socket",
24633:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24634:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24635:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24636:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24637:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24638:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24639:                                    ERROR
24640:                            end
24641:                    end},
24642:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24643:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24644:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
24645:                                ok ->
24646:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
24647:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24648:                                    ok;
24649:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24650:                                    ERROR
24651:                            end
24652:                    end},
24653:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
24654:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24655:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
24656:                            ok
24657:                    end},
24658: 
24659: 
24660:          %% The actual test
24661:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepcnt(1))",
24662:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24663:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepcnt)
24664:                    end},
24665:          #{desc => "get keepcnt",
24666:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
24667:                            case Get(Sock) of
24668:                                {ok, KeepCnt} ->
24669:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepcnt: ~p", [KeepCnt]),
24670:                                    {ok, State#{keepcnt => KeepCnt}};
24671:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24672:                                    ERROR
24673:                            end
24674:                    end},
24675:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepcnt(1))",
24676:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24677:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepcnt),
24678:                            ok
24679:                    end},
24680: 
24681: 
24682:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepcnt)",
24683:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24684:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepcnt)
24685:                    end},
24686:          #{desc => "set keepcnt",
24687:            cmd  => fun(#{sock    := Sock,
24688:                          set     := Set,
24689:                          keepcnt := KeepCnt} = State) ->
24690:                            NewKeepCnt =
24691:                                if
24692:                                    (KeepCnt >= 255) ->
24693:                                        KeepCnt - 1;
24694:                                    true ->
24695:                                        KeepCnt + 1
24696:                                end,
24697:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepCnt) of
24698:                                ok ->
24699:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepcnt updated (to ~p)",
24700:                                                [NewKeepCnt]),
24701:                                    {ok, State#{keepcnt => NewKeepCnt}};
24702:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24703:                                    ERROR
24704:                            end
24705:                    end},
24706:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepcnt)",
24707:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24708:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepcnt),
24709:                            ok
24710:                    end},
24711: 
24712: 
24713:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepcnt(2))",
24714:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24715:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepcnt)
24716:                    end},
24717:          #{desc => "get keepcnt(2)",
24718:            cmd  => fun(#{sock    := Sock,
24719:                          get     := Get,
24720:                          keepcnt := ExpKeepCnt} = _State) ->
24721:                            case Get(Sock) of
24722:                                {ok, KeepCnt} when (ExpKeepCnt =:= KeepCnt) ->
24723:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepcnt (~p)",
24724:                                                [ExpKeepCnt]),
24725:                                    ok;
24726:                                {ok, KeepCnt} ->
24727:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepcnt:"
24728:                                                "~n   Expected KeepCnt: ~p"
24729:                                                "~n   Actual KeepCnt:   ~p",
24730:                                                [ExpKeepCnt, KeepCnt]),
24731:                                    {error,
24732:                                     {unexpected_keepcnt, ExpKeepCnt, KeepCnt}};
24733:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24734:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepcnt: "
24735:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
24736:                                    ERROR
24737:                            end
24738:                    end},
24739:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepcnt)",
24740:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24741:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepcnt),
24742:                            ok
24743:                    end},
24744: 
24745: 
24746:          %% *** Termination ***
24747:          #{desc => "await terminate",
24748:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
24749:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
24750:                                ok ->
24751:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
24752:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24753:                                    ERROR
24754:                            end
24755:                    end},
24756:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
24757:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
24758:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24759:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
24760:                    end},
24761: 
24762:          %% *** We are done ***
24763:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24764:         ],
24765: 
24766: 
24767:     TesterSeq =
24768:         [
24769:          %% *** Init part ***
24770:          #{desc => "monitor server",
24771:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24772:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
24773:                            ok
24774:                    end},
24775: 
24776:          %% Start the server
24777:          #{desc => "order server start",
24778:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24779:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
24780:                            ok
24781:                    end},
24782:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
24783:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
24784:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
24785:                            ok
24786:                    end},
24787: 
24788:          %% *** The actual test ***
24789:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepcnt(1))",
24790:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24791:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepcnt),
24792:                            ok
24793:                    end},
24794:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepcnt(1))",
24795:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24796:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepcnt)
24797:                    end},
24798: 
24799:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepcnt)",
24800:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24801:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepcnt),
24802:                            ok
24803:                    end},
24804:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepcnt)",
24805:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24806:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepcnt)
24807:                    end},
24808: 
24809:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepcnt(2))",
24810:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24811:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepcnt),
24812:                            ok
24813:                    end},
24814:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepcnt(2))",
24815:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24816:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepcnt)
24817:                    end},
24818: 
24819: 
24820:          %% *** Termination ***
24821:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
24822:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
24823:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
24824:                            ok
24825:                    end},
24826:          #{desc => "await server termination",
24827:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
24828:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
24829:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
24830:                            {ok, State1}
24831:                    end},
24832: 
24833:          %% *** We are done ***
24834:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24835:         ],
24836: 
24837: 
24838:     i("start server evaluator"),
24839:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
24840: 
24841:     i("start tester evaluator"),
24842:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
24843:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
24844: 
24845:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
24846: 
24847: 
24848: 
24849: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24850: 
24851: %% Tests that the keepidle tcp socket option.
24852: %%
24853: %% "Gets or sets the number of seconds a TCP connection will remain
24854: %%  idle before keepalive probes are sent to the remote."
24855: %%
24856: 
24857: api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24858:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24859:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
24860:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepidle() end,
24861:            fun() ->
24862:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
24863:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepidle, Value)
24864:                           end,
24865:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24866:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepidle)
24867:                           end,
24868:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24869:                                  proto  => tcp,
24870:                                  set    => Set,
24871:                                  get    => Get},
24872:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp(InitState)
24873:            end).
24874: 
24875: 
24876: 
24877: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24878: 
24879: api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp(InitState) ->
24880:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
24881:     ServerSeq =
24882:         [
24883:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
24884:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
24885:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
24886:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
24887:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
24888:                    end},
24889:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
24890:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24891:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
24892:                            ok
24893:                    end},
24894: 
24895:          %% *** Init part ***
24896:          #{desc => "which local address",
24897:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24898:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24899:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
24900:                    end},
24901:          #{desc => "create socket",
24902:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24903:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24904:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
24905:                                {ok, Sock} ->
24906:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
24907:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24908:                                    ERROR
24909:                            end
24910:                    end},
24911:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
24912:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
24913:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
24914:                                ok ->
24915:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
24916:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
24917:                                    ok;
24918:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24919:                                    ERROR
24920:                            end
24921:                    end},
24922:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
24923:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24924:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
24925:                            ok
24926:                    end},
24927: 
24928: 
24929:          %% The actual test
24930:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepidle(1))",
24931:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24932:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepidle)
24933:                    end},
24934:          #{desc => "get keepidle",
24935:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
24936:                            case Get(Sock) of
24937:                                {ok, KeepIdle} ->
24938:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepidle: ~p", [KeepIdle]),
24939:                                    {ok, State#{keepidle => KeepIdle}};
24940:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24941:                                    ERROR
24942:                            end
24943:                    end},
24944:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepidle(1))",
24945:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24946:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepidle),
24947:                            ok
24948:                    end},
24949: 
24950: 
24951:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepidle)",
24952:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24953:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepidle)
24954:                    end},
24955:          #{desc => "set keepidle",
24956:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
24957:                          set      := Set,
24958:                          keepidle := KeepIdle} = State) ->
24959:                            NewKeepIdle = KeepIdle + 1,
24960:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepIdle) of
24961:                                ok ->
24962:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepidle updated (to ~p)",
24963:                                                [NewKeepIdle]),
24964:                                    {ok, State#{keepidle => NewKeepIdle}};
24965:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24966:                                    ERROR
24967:                            end
24968:                    end},
24969:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepidle)",
24970:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24971:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepidle),
24972:                            ok
24973:                    end},
24974: 
24975: 
24976:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepidle(2))",
24977:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
24978:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepidle)
24979:                    end},
24980:          #{desc => "get keepidle(2)",
24981:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
24982:                          get      := Get,
24983:                          keepidle := ExpKeepIdle} = _State) ->
24984:                            case Get(Sock) of
24985:                                {ok, KeepIdle} when (ExpKeepIdle =:= KeepIdle) ->
24986:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepidle (~p)",
24987:                                                [ExpKeepIdle]),
24988:                                    ok;
24989:                                {ok, KeepIdle} ->
24990:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepidle:"
24991:                                                "~n   Expected KeepIdle: ~p"
24992:                                                "~n   Actual KeepIdle:   ~p",
24993:                                                [ExpKeepIdle, KeepIdle]),
24994:                                    {error,
24995:                                     {unexpected_keepidle,
24996:                                      ExpKeepIdle, KeepIdle}};
24997:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24998:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepidle: "
24999:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
25000:                                    ERROR
25001:                            end
25002:                    end},
25003:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepidle(2))",
25004:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25005:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepidle),
25006:                            ok
25007:                    end},
25008: 
25009: 
25010:          %% *** Termination ***
25011:          #{desc => "await terminate",
25012:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
25013:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
25014:                                ok ->
25015:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
25016:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25017:                                    ERROR
25018:                            end
25019:                    end},
25020:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
25021:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
25022:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25023:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
25024:                    end},
25025: 
25026:          %% *** We are done ***
25027:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25028:         ],
25029: 
25030: 
25031:     TesterSeq =
25032:         [
25033:          %% *** Init part ***
25034:          #{desc => "monitor server",
25035:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25036:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
25037:                            ok
25038:                    end},
25039: 
25040:          %% Start the server
25041:          #{desc => "order server start",
25042:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25043:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
25044:                            ok
25045:                    end},
25046:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
25047:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25048:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
25049:                            ok
25050:                    end},
25051: 
25052:          %% *** The actual test ***
25053:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepidle(1))",
25054:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25055:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepidle),
25056:                            ok
25057:                    end},
25058:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepidle(1))",
25059:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25060:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepidle)
25061:                    end},
25062: 
25063:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepidle)",
25064:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25065:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepidle),
25066:                            ok
25067:                    end},
25068:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepidle)",
25069:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25070:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepidle)
25071:                    end},
25072: 
25073:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepidle(2))",
25074:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25075:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepidle),
25076:                            ok
25077:                    end},
25078:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepidle(2))",
25079:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25080:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepidle)
25081:                    end},
25082: 
25083: 
25084:          %% *** Termination ***
25085:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
25086:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25087:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
25088:                            ok
25089:                    end},
25090:          #{desc => "await server termination",
25091:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
25092:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
25093:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
25094:                            {ok, State1}
25095:                    end},
25096: 
25097:          %% *** We are done ***
25098:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25099:         ],
25100: 
25101: 
25102:     i("start server evaluator"),
25103:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
25104: 
25105:     i("start tester evaluator"),
25106:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
25107:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
25108: 
25109:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
25110: 
25111: 
25112: 
25113: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25114: 
25115: %% Tests that the keepintvl tcp socket option.
25116: %%
25117: %% "Gets or sets the number of seconds a TCP connection will wait for
25118: %%  a keepalive response before sending another keepalive probe."
25119: %%
25120: 
25121: api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25122:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25123:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
25124:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepintvl() end,
25125:            fun() ->
25126:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
25127:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepintvl, Value)
25128:                           end,
25129:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
25130:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepintvl)
25131:                           end,
25132:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
25133:                                  proto  => tcp,
25134:                                  set    => Set,
25135:                                  get    => Get},
25136:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp(InitState)
25137:            end).
25138: 
25139: 
25140: 
25141: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25142: 
25143: api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp(InitState) ->
25144:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
25145:     ServerSeq =
25146:         [
25147:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
25148:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
25149:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
25150:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
25151:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
25152:                    end},
25153:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
25154:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25155:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
25156:                            ok
25157:                    end},
25158: 
25159:          %% *** Init part ***
25160:          #{desc => "which local address",
25161:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
25162:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
25163:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
25164:                    end},
25165:          #{desc => "create socket",
25166:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25167:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25168:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
25169:                                {ok, Sock} ->
25170:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
25171:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25172:                                    ERROR
25173:                            end
25174:                    end},
25175:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
25176:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
25177:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
25178:                                ok ->
25179:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
25180:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
25181:                                    ok;
25182:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25183:                                    ERROR
25184:                            end
25185:                    end},
25186:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
25187:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25188:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
25189:                            ok
25190:                    end},
25191: 
25192: 
25193:          %% The actual test
25194:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepintvl(1))",
25195:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25196:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepintvl)
25197:                    end},
25198:          #{desc => "get keepintvl",
25199:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
25200:                            case Get(Sock) of
25201:                                {ok, KeepIntVl} ->
25202:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepintvl: ~p", [KeepIntVl]),
25203:                                    {ok, State#{keepintvl => KeepIntVl}};
25204:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25205:                                    ERROR
25206:                            end
25207:                    end},
25208:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepintvl(1))",
25209:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25210:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepintvl),
25211:                            ok
25212:                    end},
25213: 
25214: 
25215:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepintvl)",
25216:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25217:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepintvl)
25218:                    end},
25219:          #{desc => "set keepintvl",
25220:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
25221:                          set      := Set,
25222:                          keepintvl := KeepIntVl} = State) ->
25223:                            NewKeepIntVl = KeepIntVl + 1,
25224:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepIntVl) of
25225:                                ok ->
25226:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepIntVl updated (to ~p)",
25227:                                                [NewKeepIntVl]),
25228:                                    {ok, State#{keepintvl => NewKeepIntVl}};
25229:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25230:                                    ERROR
25231:                            end
25232:                    end},
25233:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepintvl)",
25234:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25235:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepintvl),
25236:                            ok
25237:                    end},
25238: 
25239: 
25240:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepintvl(2))",
25241:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25242:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepintvl)
25243:                    end},
25244:          #{desc => "get keepintvl(2)",
25245:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
25246:                          get       := Get,
25247:                          keepintvl := ExpKeepIntVl} = _State) ->
25248:                            case Get(Sock) of
25249:                                {ok, KeepIntVl}
25250:                                  when (ExpKeepIntVl =:= KeepIntVl) ->
25251:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepintvl (~p)",
25252:                                                [ExpKeepIntVl]),
25253:                                    ok;
25254:                                {ok, KeepIntVl} ->
25255:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepintvl:"
25256:                                                "~n   Expected KeepIntVl: ~p"
25257:                                                "~n   Actual KeepIntVl:   ~p",
25258:                                                [ExpKeepIntVl, KeepIntVl]),
25259:                                    {error,
25260:                                     {unexpected_keepintvl,
25261:                                      ExpKeepIntVl, KeepIntVl}};
25262:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25263:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepintvl: "
25264:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
25265:                                    ERROR
25266:                            end
25267:                    end},
25268:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepintvl(2))",
25269:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25270:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepintvl),
25271:                            ok
25272:                    end},
25273: 
25274: 
25275:          %% *** Termination ***
25276:          #{desc => "await terminate",
25277:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
25278:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
25279:                                ok ->
25280:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
25281:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25282:                                    ERROR
25283:                            end
25284:                    end},
25285:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
25286:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
25287:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25288:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
25289:                    end},
25290: 
25291:          %% *** We are done ***
25292:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25293:         ],
25294: 
25295: 
25296:     TesterSeq =
25297:         [
25298:          %% *** Init part ***
25299:          #{desc => "monitor server",
25300:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25301:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
25302:                            ok
25303:                    end},
25304: 
25305:          %% Start the server
25306:          #{desc => "order server start",
25307:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25308:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
25309:                            ok
25310:                    end},
25311:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
25312:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25313:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
25314:                            ok
25315:                    end},
25316: 
25317:          %% *** The actual test ***
25318:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepintvl(1))",
25319:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25320:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepintvl),
25321:                            ok
25322:                    end},
25323:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepintvl(1))",
25324:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25325:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepintvl)
25326:                    end},
25327: 
25328:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepintvl)",
25329:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25330:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepintvl),
25331:                            ok
25332:                    end},
25333:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepintvl)",
25334:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25335:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepintvl)
25336:                    end},
25337: 
25338:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepintvl(2))",
25339:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25340:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepintvl),
25341:                            ok
25342:                    end},
25343:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepintvl(2))",
25344:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25345:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepintvl)
25346:                    end},
25347: 
25348: 
25349:          %% *** Termination ***
25350:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
25351:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25352:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
25353:                            ok
25354:                    end},
25355:          #{desc => "await server termination",
25356:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
25357:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
25358:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
25359:                            {ok, State1}
25360:                    end},
25361: 
25362:          %% *** We are done ***
25363:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25364:         ],
25365: 
25366: 
25367:     i("start server evaluator"),
25368:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
25369: 
25370:     i("start tester evaluator"),
25371:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
25372:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
25373: 
25374:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
25375: 
25376: 
25377: 
25378: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25379: 
25380: %% Tests that the cork udp socket option.
25381: %%
25382: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
25383: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
25384: %%
25385: 
25386: api_opt_udp_cork_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25387:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25388:     tc_try(api_opt_udp_cork_udp4,
25389:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_udp_cork() end,
25390:            fun() ->
25391:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
25392:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, udp, cork, Value)
25393:                           end,
25394:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
25395:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, udp, cork)
25396:                           end,
25397:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
25398:                                  proto  => udp,
25399:                                  set    => Set,
25400:                                  get    => Get},
25401:                    ok = api_opt_udp_cork_udp(InitState)
25402:            end).
25403: 
25404: 
25405: 
25406: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25407: 
25408: api_opt_udp_cork_udp(InitState) ->
25409:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
25410:     TesterSeq =
25411:         [
25412:          %% *** Init part ***
25413:          #{desc => "which local address",
25414:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
25415:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
25416:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
25417:                    end},
25418:          #{desc => "create socket",
25419:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25420:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25421:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
25422:                                {ok, Sock} ->
25423:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
25424:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25425:                                    ERROR
25426:                            end
25427:                    end},
25428:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
25429:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
25430:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
25431:                                ok ->
25432:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
25433:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
25434:                                    ok;
25435:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25436:                                    ERROR
25437:                            end
25438:                    end},
25439: 
25440: 
25441:          %% The actual test
25442:          #{desc => "get (default) cork (= false)",
25443:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
25444:                            case Get(Sock) of
25445:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
25446:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork default: ~p", [Value]),
