27134: %% on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
27135: api_to_recvmsg_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27136:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27137:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_udp6,
27138:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
27139:            fun() ->
27140:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
27141:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
27142:                                  recv    => Recv,
27143:                                  timeout => 2000},
27144:                    ok = api_to_receive_udp(InitState)
27145:            end).
27146: 
27147: 
27148: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27149: 
27150: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
27151: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
27152: api_to_recvmsg_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27153:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27154:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_tcp4,
27155:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
27156:            fun() ->
27157:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
27158:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet,
27159:                                  recv    => Recv,
27160:                                  timeout => 2000},
27161:                    ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState)
27162:            end).
27163: 
27164: 
27165: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27166: 
27167: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
27168: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
27169: api_to_recvmsg_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27170:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27171:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_tcp6,
27172:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
27173:            fun() ->
27174:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
27175:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
27176:                                  recv    => Recv,
27177:                                  timeout => 2000},
27178:                    ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState)
27179:            end).
27180: 
27181: 
27182: 
27183: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27184: 
27185: sock_open(Domain, Type, Proto) ->
27186:     try socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
27187:         {ok, Socket} ->
27188:             Socket;
27189:         {error, Reason} ->
27190:             ?FAIL({open, Reason})
27191:     catch
27192:         C:E:S ->
27193:             ?FAIL({open, C, E, S})
27194:     end.
27195: 
27196: 
27197: sock_bind(Sock, LSA) ->
27198:     try socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
27199:         ok = OK ->
27200:             OK;
27201:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
27202:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Address not available"),
27203:             throw({skip, Reason});
27204:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
27205:             ERROR
27206:     catch
27207:         C:E:S ->
27208:             ?FAIL({bind, C, E, S})
27209:     end.
27210: 
27211: sock_connect(Sock, SockAddr) ->
27212:     try socket:connect(Sock, SockAddr) of
27213:         ok ->
27214:             ok;
27215:         {error, Reason} ->
27216:             ?FAIL({connect, Reason})
27217:     catch
27218:         C:E:S ->
27219:             ?FAIL({connect, C, E, S})
27220:     end.
27221:     
27222: sock_sockname(Sock) ->
27223:     try socket:sockname(Sock) of
27224:         {ok, SockAddr} ->
27225:             SockAddr;
27226:         {error, Reason} ->
27227:             ?FAIL({sockname, Reason})
27228:     catch
27229:         C:E:S ->
27230:             ?FAIL({sockname, C, E, S})
27231:     end.
27232:     
27233: sock_port(S) ->
27234:     case sock_sockname(S) of
27235:         #{port := Port} -> Port;
27236:         _               -> undefined
27237:     end.
27238: 
27239: sock_close(Sock) ->
27240:     try socket:close(Sock) of
27241:         ok ->
27242:             ok;
27243:         {error, Reason} ->
27244:             i("sock_close -> error: ~p", [Reason]),
27245:             ?FAIL({close, Reason})
27246:     catch
27247:         C:E:S ->
27248:             i("sock_close -> failed: ~p, ~p, ~p", [C, E, S]),
27249:             ?FAIL({close, C, E, S})
27250:     end.
27251: 
27252: 
27253: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27254: 
27255: local_host() ->
27256:     try net_adm:localhost() of
27257:         Host when is_list(Host) ->
27258: 	    %% Convert to shortname if long
27259: 	    case string:tokens(Host, [$.]) of
27260: 		[H|_] ->
27261: 		    list_to_atom(H)
27262: 	    end
27263:     catch
27264:         C:E:S ->
27265:             erlang:raise(C, E, S)
27266:     end.
27267: 
27268: 
27269: %% The point of this is to "ensure" that paths from different test runs
27270: %% don't clash.
27271: 
27272: mk_unique_path() ->
27273:     ?SLIB:mk_unique_path().
27274: 
27275: 
27276: which_local_socket_addr(local = Domain) ->
27277:     #{family => Domain,
27278:       path   => mk_unique_path()};
27279: 
27280: %% This gets the local socket address (not 127.0...)
27281: %% We should really implement this using the (new) net module,
27282: %% but until that gets the necessary functionality...
27283: which_local_socket_addr(Domain) ->
27284:     case ?KLIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
27285:         {ok, [#{addr := Addr}|_]} ->
27286:             #{family => Domain,
27287:               addr   => Addr};
27288:         {error, Reason} ->
27289:             ?FAIL(Reason)
27290:     end.
27291: 
27292: which_local_host_info(Domain) ->
27293:     case ?KLIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
27294:         {ok, [Info|_]} ->
27295:             {ok, Info#{family => Domain}};
27296:         {error, Reason} ->
27297:             ?FAIL(Reason)
27298:     end.
27299: 
27300: 
27301: 
27302: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27303: 
27304: %% monitored_by() ->
27305: %%     monitored_by(self()).
27306: %% monitored_by(Pid) ->	
27307: %%     {monitored_by, Refs} = erlang:process_info(Pid, monitored_by),
27308: %%     Refs.
27309: 
27310: 
27311: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27312: 
27313: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
27314: 
27315: %% We also need to (be able to) figure out the multicast address,
27316: %% which we only support for some platforms (linux and sunos).
27317: %% We don't do that here, but since we can only do that (find a
27318: %% multicast address) for specific platforms, we check that we are
27319: %% on of those platforms here.
27320: has_support_ip_multicast() ->
27321:     case os:type() of
27322:         {unix, OsName} when (OsName =:= linux) orelse
27323:                             (OsName =:= sunos) ->
27324:             case ?SLIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
27325:                 {ok, #{flags := Flags}} ->
27326:                     case lists:member(multicast, Flags) of
27327:                         true ->
27328:                             ok;
27329:                         false ->
27330:                             not_supported(multicast)
27331:                     end;
27332:                 {error, Reason} ->
27333:                     not_supported({multicast, Reason})
27334:             end;
27335:         {unix, OsName} ->
27336:             skip(?F("Not Supported: platform ~w", [OsName]));
27337:         Type ->
27338:             skip(?F("Not Supported: platform ~p", [Type]))
27339:     end.
27340: 
27341: 
27342: %% --- SOCK socket option test functions ---
27343: 
27344: has_support_sock_acceptconn() ->
27345:     has_support_socket_option_sock(acceptconn).
27346: 
27347: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
27348:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
27349: 
27350: has_support_sock_broadcast() ->
27351:     has_support_ipv4(),
27352:     has_support_socket_option_sock(broadcast),
27353:     case ?SLIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
27354:         {ok, #{flags := Flags}} ->
27355:             case lists:member(broadcast, Flags) of
27356:                 true ->
27357:                     ok;
27358:                 false ->
27359:                     not_supported({broadcast, Flags})
27360:             end;
27361:         {error, Reason} ->
27362:             not_supported({broadcast, Reason})
27363:     end.
27364: 
27365: has_support_sock_debug() ->
27366:     has_support_socket_option_sock(debug).
27367: 
27368: has_support_sock_domain() ->
27369:     has_support_socket_option_sock(domain).
27370: 
27371: has_support_sock_dontroute() ->
27372:     has_support_socket_option_sock(dontroute).
27373: 
27374: has_support_sock_keepalive() ->
27375:     has_support_socket_option_sock(keepalive).
27376: 
27377: has_support_sock_reuseaddr() ->
27378:     has_support_socket_option_sock(reuseaddr).
27379: 
27380: has_support_sock_bsp_state() ->
27381:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bsp_state).
27382: 
27383: has_support_sock_exclusiveaddruse() ->
27384:     has_support_socket_option_sock(exclusiveaddruse).
27385: 
27386: has_support_sock_maxdg() ->
27387:     has_support_socket_option_sock(maxdg).
27388: 
27389: has_support_sock_max_msg_size() ->
27390:     has_support_socket_option_sock(max_msg_size).
27391: 
27392: has_support_sock_oobinline() ->
27393:     has_support_socket_option_sock(oobinline).
27394: 
27395: has_support_sock_passcred() ->
27396:     has_support_socket_option_sock(passcred).
27397: 
27398: has_support_sock_peek_off() ->
27399:     has_support_socket_option_sock(peek_off).
27400: 
27401: has_support_sock_peercred() ->
27402:     has_support_socket_option_sock(peercred).
27403: 
27404: has_support_sock_priority() ->
27405:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
27406: 
27407: has_support_sock_rcvbuf() ->
27408:     has_support_socket_option_sock(rcvbuf).
27409: 
27410: has_support_sock_rcvlowat() ->
27411:     has_support_socket_option_sock(rcvlowat).
27412: 
27413: has_support_sock_rcvtimeo() ->
27414:     has_support_socket_option_sock(rcvtimeo).
27415: 
27416: has_support_sock_sndbuf() ->
27417:     has_support_socket_option_sock(sndbuf).
27418: 
27419: has_support_sock_sndlowat() ->
27420:     has_support_socket_option_sock(sndlowat).
27421: 
27422: has_support_sock_sndtimeo() ->
27423:     has_support_socket_option_sock(sndtimeo).
27424: 
27425: has_support_sock_timestamp() ->
27426:     has_support_socket_option_sock(timestamp).
27427: 
27428: 
27429: %% --- IP socket option test functions ---
27430: 
27431: has_support_ip_add_membership() ->
27432:     has_support_socket_option_ip(add_membership).
27433: 
27434: has_support_ip_drop_membership() ->
27435:     has_support_socket_option_ip(drop_membership).
27436: 
27437: has_support_ip_pktinfo() ->
27438:     has_support_socket_option_ip(pktinfo).
27439: 
27440: has_support_ip_recvopts() ->
27441:     has_support_socket_option_ip(recvopts).
27442: 
27443: has_support_ip_recvorigdstaddr() ->
27444:     has_support_socket_option_ip(recvorigdstaddr).
27445: 
27446: has_support_ip_recvtos() ->
27447:     has_support_socket_option_ip(recvtos).
27448: 
27449: has_support_ip_recvtos_and_or_sock_timestamp() ->
27450:     case (socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvtos) orelse 
27451:           socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp)) of
27452:         true ->
27453:             ok;
27454:         false ->
27455:             skip(?F("Neither needed opts "
27456:                     "ip:recvtos or socket:timestamp supported", []))
27457:     end.
27458: 
27459: has_support_ip_recvttl() ->
27460:     has_support_socket_option_ip(recvttl).
27461: 
27462: has_support_ip_tos() ->
27463:     has_support_socket_option_ip(tos).
27464: 
27465: has_support_ip_recverr() ->
27466:     has_support_socket_option_ip(recverr).
27467: 
27468: 
27469: %% --- IPv6 socket option test functions ---
27470: 
27471: has_support_ipv6_flowinfo() ->
27472:     has_support_socket_option_ipv6(flowinfo).
27473: 
27474: has_support_ipv6_hoplimit_or_recvhoplimit() ->
27475:     %% case (socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvhoplimit) orelse
27476:     %%       socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, hoplimit)) of
27477:     case is_any_options_supported([{ipv6, recvhoplimit}, {ipv6, hoplimit}]) of
27478: 	true ->
27479: 	    ok;
27480: 	false ->
27481: 	    skip(?F("Neither recvhoplimit or hoplimit supported", []))
27482:     end.
27483: 
27484: has_support_ipv6_recvpktinfo() ->
27485:     has_support_socket_option_ipv6(recvpktinfo).
27486: 
27487: 
27488: has_support_ipv6_tclass_or_recvtclass() ->
27489:     case is_any_options_supported([{ipv6, recvtclass}, {ipv6, tclass}]) of
27490: 	true ->
27491: 	    ok;
27492: 	false ->
27493: 	    skip(?F("Neither recvtclass or tclass supported", []))
27494:     end.
27495: 
27496: 
27497: has_support_ipv6_recverr() ->
27498:     has_support_socket_option_ipv6(recverr).
27499: 
27500: 
27501: %% --- TCP socket option test functions ---
27502: 
27503: has_support_tcp_congestion() ->
27504:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(congestion).
27505: 
27506: has_support_tcp_cork() ->
27507:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(cork).
27508: 
27509: has_support_tcp_maxseg() ->
27510:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(maxseg).
27511: 
27512: has_support_tcp_nodelay() ->
27513:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(nodelay).
27514: 
27515: has_support_tcp_keepcnt() ->
27516:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(keepcnt).
27517: 
27518: has_support_tcp_keepidle() ->
27519:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(keepidle).
27520: 
27521: has_support_tcp_keepintvl() ->
27522:     has_support_socket_option_tcp(keepintvl).
27523: 
27524: 
27525: %% --- UDP socket option test functions ---
27526: 
27527: has_support_udp_cork() ->
27528:     has_support_socket_option_udp(cork).
27529: 
27530: 
27531: %% --- General purpose socket option test functions ---
27532: 
27533: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
27534:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
27535: 
27536: has_support_socket_option_ip(Opt) ->
27537:     has_support_socket_option(ip, Opt).
27538: 
27539: has_support_socket_option_ipv6(Opt) ->
27540:     has_support_socket_option(ipv6, Opt).
27541: 
27542: has_support_socket_option_tcp(Opt) ->
27543:     has_support_socket_option(tcp, Opt).
27544: 
27545: has_support_socket_option_udp(Opt) ->
27546:     has_support_socket_option(udp, Opt).
27547: 
27548: 
27549: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
27550:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
27551:         true ->
27552:             ok;
27553:         false ->
27554:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
27555:     end.
27556: 
27557: is_any_options_supported(Options) ->
27558:     Pred = fun({Level, Option}) -> socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) end,
27559:     lists:any(Pred, Options).
27560: 
27561: 
27562: %% --- Send flag test functions ---
27563: 
27564: has_support_msg_flag(Flag) ->
27565:     case socket:is_supported(msg_flags, Flag) of
27566:         true ->
27567:             ok;
27568:         false ->
27569:             skip(?F("Message flag ~w *Not* Supported", [Flag]))
27570:     end.
27571: 
27572: 
27573: %% Checks that the version is "good enough" (of the specified platform).
27574: 
27575: is_good_enough_linux(CondVsn) ->
27576:     is_good_enough_platform(unix, linux, CondVsn).
27577: 
27578: is_good_enough_darwin(CondVsn) ->
27579:     is_good_enough_platform(unix, darwin, CondVsn).
27580: 
27581: is_good_enough_montavista(_Vsn) ->
27582:     %% We have *one* old M, which have kernel version 2.6.10.
27583:     %% So if its that kernel version, we only need to check
27584:     %% if its M (no need to figure out the version of M).
27585:     case os:type() of
27586:         {unix, linux} ->
27587:             case os:version() of
27588:                 {2,6,10} ->
27589:                     case etc_issue() of
27590:                         "MontaVista" ++ _ = V -> % Stone age MontaVista => Skip
27591:                             skip(V);
27592:                         _ ->
27593:                             ok
27594:                     end;
27595:                 _ ->
27596:                     ok
27597:             end;
27598:         _ ->
27599:             ok
27600:     end.
27601:                     
27602: 
27603: is_good_enough_platform(Family, Name, CondVsn) ->
27604:     case os:type() of
27605: 	{Family, Name} ->
27606: 	    ID = fun() -> ?F("~w:~w", [Family, Name]) end,
27607: 	    is_good_enough_platform2(os:version(), CondVsn, ID);
27608: 	_ ->
27609: 	    ok
27610:     end.
27611: 
27612: is_good_enough_platform2(Vsn, CondVsn, _) when (Vsn > CondVsn) ->
27613:     ok;
27614: is_good_enough_platform2(Vsn, CondVsn, ID) ->
27615:     skip(?F("Not 'good enough' ~s (~p <= ~p)", [ID(), Vsn, CondVsn])).
27616: 
27617: is_not_freebsd() ->
27618:     is_not_platform(freebsd, "FreeBSD").
27619: 
27620: is_not_openbsd() ->
27621:     is_not_platform(openbsd, "OpenBSD").
27622: 
27623: is_not_netbsd() ->
27624:     is_not_platform(netbsd, "NetBSD").
27625: 
27626: is_not_darwin() ->
27627:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
27628: 
27629: etc_issue() ->
27630:     string:trim(os:cmd("cat /etc/issue")).
27631: 
27632: is_not_windows() ->
27633:     case os:type() of
27634:         {win32, nt} ->
27635:             skip("This does not work on Windows");
27636:         _ ->
27637:             ok
27638:     end.
27639: 
27640: 
27641: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
27642:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
27643:       case os:type() of
27644:           {unix, Platform} ->
27645:               skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
27646:         _ ->
27647:             ok
27648:     end.
27649:   
27650: 
27651: unix_domain_socket_host_cond() ->
27652:     unix_domain_socket_host_cond(os:type(), os:version()).
27653: 
27654: unix_domain_socket_host_cond({unix, linux}, {M, _, _}) when (M < 3) ->
27655:     skip("TC may not work on this version");
27656: unix_domain_socket_host_cond(_, _) ->
27657:     ok.
27658: 
27659: has_support_unix_domain_socket() ->
27660:     case socket:is_supported(local) of
27661: 	true ->
27662: 	    ok;
27663: 	false ->
27664: 	    skip("Not supported")
27665:     end.
27666: 
27667: has_support_sctp() ->
27668:     case os:type() of
27669:         {win32, _} ->
27670:             skip("Not supported");
27671:         {unix, netbsd} ->
27672:             %% XXX We will have to investigate this later...
27673:             skip("Not supported");
27674:         _ ->
27675:             case socket:is_supported(sctp) of
27676:                 true ->
27677:                     ok;
27678:                 false ->
27679:                     skip("Not supported")
27680:             end
27681:     end.
27682: 
27683: 
27684: %% The idea is that this function shall test if the test host has 
27685: %% support for IPv4 or IPv6. If not, there is no point in running corresponding tests.
27686: %% Currently we just skip.
27687: has_support_ipv4() ->
27688:     ?KLIB:has_support_ipv4().
27689: 
27690: has_support_ipv6() ->
27691:     ?KLIB:has_support_ipv6().
27692: 
27693: inet_or_inet6() ->
27694:     try
27695:         has_support_ipv4(),
27696:         inet
27697:     catch
27698:         throw:{skip, _Reason} ->
27699:             has_support_ipv6(),
27700:             inet6
27701:     end.
27702: 
27703: has_support_sendfile() ->
27704:     try socket:is_supported(sendfile) of
27705:         true ->
27706:             ok;
27707:         false ->
27708:             skip("Not supported: sendfile")
27709:     catch
27710:         error : notsup ->
27711:             skip("Not supported: socket")
27712:     end.
27713: 
27714: has_multi_scheds() ->
27715:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers) of
27716:         N when (N > 1) ->
27717:             ok;
27718:         _ ->
27719:             skip("Num schedulers *not* > 1")
27720:     end.
27721: 
27722: 
27723: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27724: 
27725: unlink_path(Path) ->
27726:     unlink_path(Path, fun() -> ok end, fun() -> ok end).
27727: 
27728: unlink_path(Path, Success, Failure)
27729:   when is_function(Success, 0), is_function(Failure, 0) ->
27730:     case Path of
27731:         undefined ->
27732:             ?SEV_IPRINT("not a path to unlink"),
27733:                     Success();
27734:         _ ->
27735:             ?SEV_IPRINT("try unlink path: "
27736:                         "~n   ~s", [Path]),
27737:             case file:delete(Path) of
27738:                 ok ->
27739:                     ?SEV_IPRINT("path unlinked: "
27740:                                 "~n   Path: ~s", [Path]),
27741:                     Success();
27742:                 Error ->
27743:                     ?SEV_EPRINT("unlink failed: "
27744:                                 "~n   Path: ~s"
27745:                                 "~n   Res:  ~p", [Path, Error]),
27746:                     Failure()
27747:             end
27748:     end.
27749: 
27750: 
27751: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27752: 
27753: not_supported(What) ->
27754:     skip({not_supported, What}).
27755: 
27756: not_yet_implemented() ->
27757:     skip("not yet implemented").
27758: 
27759: skip(Reason) ->
27760:     throw({skip, Reason}).
27761: 
27762: 
27763: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27764: 
27765: %% *** tc_try/2,3 ***
27766: %% Case:      Basically the test case name
27767: %% TCCondFun: A fun that is evaluated before the actual test case
27768: %%            The point of this is that it can performs checks to
27769: %%            see if we shall run the test case at all.
27770: %%            For instance, the test case may only work in specific
27771: %%            conditions.
27772: %% FCFun:     The test case fun
27773: tc_try(Case, TCFun) ->
27774:     ?TC_TRY(Case, TCFun).
27775: 
27776: tc_try(Case, TCCondFun, TCFun) ->
27777:     ?TC_TRY(Case, TCCondFun, TCFun).
27778:    
27779: 
27780: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27781: 
27782: start_node(Name) ->
27783:     start_node(Name, 5000).
27784: 
27785: start_node(Name, Timeout) when is_integer(Timeout) andalso (Timeout > 0) ->
27786:     Pa   = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
27787:     Args = ["-pa", Pa,
27788:             "-s", atom_to_list(?PROXY), "start", atom_to_list(node()),
27789:             "-s", "global", "sync"],
27790:     try ?CT_PEER(#{name      => Name,
27791:                    wait_boot => Timeout,
27792:                    args      => Args}) of
27793:         {ok, Peer, Node} ->
27794:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Started node ~p - now (global) sync", [Name]),
27795:             global:sync(), % Again, just in case...
27796:             ?SEV_IPRINT("ping proxy"),
27797:             pong = ?PPING(Node),
27798:             {Peer, Node};
27799:         {error, Reason} ->
27800:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed starting node ~p (=> SKIP):"
27801:                         "~n   ~p", [Name, Reason]),
27802:             skip(Reason)
27803:     catch
27804:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
27805:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed starting node: "
27806:                         "~n   Class:  ~p"
27807:                         "~n   Reason: ~p"
27808:                         "~n   Stack:  ~p",
27809:                         [Class, Reason, Stack]),
27810:             skip({node_start, Class, Reason})
27811:     end.
27812: 
27813:             
27814: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27815: 
27816: nowait(Config) ->
27817:     case lists:member({select_handle, true}, Config) of
27818:         true ->
27819:             make_ref();
27820:         false ->
27821:             nowait
27822:     end.
27823: 
27824: i(F) ->
27825:     i(F, []).
27826: 
27827: i(F, A) ->
27828:     FStr = ?F("[~s] " ++ F, [?FTS()|A]),
27829:     io:format(user, FStr ++ "~n", []),
27830:     io:format(FStr, []).
27831:
